analyzed: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo ;

original: / thams cad mkhyen dang thams cad dga' //
analyzed: / thams cad mkhyen dang thams cad dga' //

original: dngos grub thob la phyag 'tshal nas //

original: stong chen rab 'joms mdo sde yang //

original: 'bum 'grel bdag gis bshad par bya //

analyzed: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni kun dga' bo'o //

analyzed: grogs med dam zhe na /

original: nyan thos la sogs pa thabs cig tu thos pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa thabs cig tu thos pa'o //

original: su las thos na /
analyzed: su las thos na /
translated: If it is asked, From whom did he hear it?

original: bcom ldan 'das las so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las so //

original: gang thos na stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa'i mdo 'di thos pa'o //
analyzed: gang thos na stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa'i mdo 'di thos pa'o //
translated: What is heard? This sutra, The Greatly Frightening Destruction of the Great Thousand.

original: sus thos na kun dga' bos thos so //
analyzed: sus thos na kun dga' bos thos so //
translated: Who hears? Ananda hears.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gnyis la 'jug ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gnyis la 'jug ste /
translated: The word at one time has two meanings:

original: sdud pa po shes rab che bar go ba dang / dam pa'i chos 'byung bar dkon pa'i don to //
analyzed: sdud pa po shes rab che bar go ba dang / dam pa'i chos 'byung bar dkon pa'i don to //
translated: to understand that the compiler has great wisdom, and to understand that the arising of the holy Dharma is rare.

original: ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The teacher is the Bhagavan.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /🔽bcom pa ni bzhi @2a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni / bcom pa ni bzhi @2a * //
translated: Bhagavan means:🔽Bhag means destroyed, and avat means four.

original: bcom // bzhi ni dgra'o //
analyzed: bcom // bzhi ni dgra'o //
translated: Four means enemies.

original: dgra ni bdud bzhi'o //
analyzed: dgra ni bdud bzhi'o //
translated: Enemies means the four maras.

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang bzhi'o //

original: gang gi dus na bcom zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dus na bcom zhe na /
translated: When is it destroyed?

original: rdo rje gdan la bzhugs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gdan la bzhugs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: When he was sitting on Vajra Seat.

original: ldan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ldan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Possessing means:

original: skal ba dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: since he possesses good fortune, he is the Bhagavan.

original: 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Gone beyond means:

original: mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: gone beyond sorrow.

original: 'das pa ni gang gi dus na 'das she na /
analyzed: 'das pa ni gang gi dus na 'das she na /
translated: When did the past occur?

original: dpyid zla ra ba'i gnam stong gi nub mo //
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba'i gnam stong gi nub mo //
translated: On the evening of the new moon of the first spring month.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang 'khor bzhi la sogs pa la zhal chems phog pa la nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang 'khor bzhi la sogs pa la zhal chems phog pa la nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu /
translated: The Bodhisattva, the Hearers, the four retinues, and so on, were given his last testament. He said, “After I pass into nirvāṇa,

original: nga'i chos 'di dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus pas bsdu ba gyis shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: nga'i chos 'di dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus pas bsdu ba gyis shig ces gsungs so //
translated: gather my Dharma into an assembly of five hundred arhats.”

original: de nas sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas de'i phyi de dbyar ka dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus nas bka' bgros mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas de'i phyi de dbyar ka dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus nas bka' bgros mdzad de /
translated: Then, after the Buddha passed into nirvāṇa, in the summer that followed, five hundred arhats gathered and discussed the matter.

original: sdud pa po sla la don bsdu ba mdzad do //
analyzed: sdud pa po sla la don bsdu ba mdzad do //
translated: They made the collection easy to compile and summarized the meaning.

original: de nas lo brgya nyi shu na /
analyzed: de nas lo brgya nyi shu na /
translated: Then, after one hundred and twenty years,

original: dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus te rgyal po ma skyes dgras yon bdag byas te tshig bsdu ba mdzad do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus te rgyal po ma skyes dgras yon bdag byas te tshig bsdu ba mdzad do //
translated: five hundred arhats gathered and King Ajātaśatru acted as their benefactor and they compiled the words.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa lam gsungs zer ba dang / ma gsungs pa la gsungs zer ba byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa lam gsungs zer ba dang / ma gsungs pa la gsungs zer ba byung ngo //
translated: At that time, some said, “The Buddha taught the path,” and some said, “He did not teach the path.”

original: de nas dgra bcom pa rnams kyis bka' bgros pa da lta'i dus su bdag cag bcom ldan 'das las dngos su thos pa rnams kyang ma mthun na /
analyzed: de nas dgra bcom pa rnams kyis bka' bgros pa da lta'i dus su bdag cag bcom ldan 'das las dngos su thos pa rnams kyang ma mthun na /
translated: Then the arhats discussed the matter, saying, “At this time, even those of us who heard the teachings directly from the Bhagavān do not agree.

original: phyi rabs pa thams cad sgro skur @2b 'ba' zhig tu 'byung bas /
analyzed: phyi rabs pa thams cad sgro skur @2b 'ba' zhig tu 'byung bas /
translated: In the future, everyone will be nothing but slanderers and denigrators.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' rtags su rgya rnam gsum gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' rtags su rgya rnam gsum gdab par bya'o //
translated: We must seal the Buddha’s words with the three seals.”

original: sdom pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rgya dang / dge ba gsum gyi rgya dang / chos rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi'i rgyas btab pa la /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rgya dang / dge ba gsum gyi rgya dang / chos rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi'i rgyas btab pa la /
translated: They sealed it with the seal of the verses of the vows, the seal of the three virtues, and the seal of the four seals of the Dharma signs.

original: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma 'dir ni dge ba gsum dang / bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma 'dir ni dge ba gsum dang / bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: Here, in the Great Lady Who Destroys the World, it is sealed with the three virtues and the four seals of the Buddha’s words.

original: kye nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngas bshad pa'i chos thams cad thag pa gsum du bshad kyang /
analyzed: kye nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngas bshad pa'i chos thams cad thag pa gsum du bshad kyang /
translated: “Oh, śrāvakas and bodhisattvas! Although I have explained all dharmas with three strings,

original: theg pa ni gcig yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: theg pa ni gcig yin par gsungs so //
translated: I have taught that there is only one vehicle.”🔽Then Śāriputra rose up

original: de nas sh'a ri'i bu langs te /
analyzed: de nas sh'a ri'i bu langs te /
translated: and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas mgo bos phyag 'tshal te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas mgo bos phyag 'tshal te ;
translated: He circumambulated the Bhagavān three times and bowed his head in homage.

original: sh'a ri'i bus bka' stsal du gsol zhes zhus so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus bka' stsal du gsol zhes zhus so //
translated: Śāriputra said, “Please explain.”

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa ni gsum zhes bya bar gsungs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa ni gsum zhes bya bar gsungs na /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Śāriputra, it is said that there are three yānas.

original: theg pa gcig yin zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: theg pa gcig yin zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: To say that there is one yāna is contradictory.”🔽Then the Bhagavān said, “Śāriputra, listen!

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'am rigs kyi bu nyon cig / dper na sngon gyi dus su mi rgan po cig yod de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'am rigs kyi bu nyon cig / dper na sngon gyi dus su mi rgan po cig yod de /
translated: Once there was an old man.

original: shin tu phyug pa nor dang yo byad phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: shin tu phyug pa nor dang yo byad phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: He was very wealthy, with abundant wealth and possessions.

original: rnam thos sras kyi nor ji tsam yod pa de tsam yod de /
analyzed: rnam thos sras kyi nor ji tsam yod pa de tsam yod de /
translated: He had as much wealth as Vaiśravaṇa.

original: rgan po de'i bu dgras khyer nas ma rnyed do //
analyzed: rgan po de'i bu dgras khyer nas ma rnyed do //
translated: The old man’s son was carried off by enemies and not found.

original: rgan mo des mya ngan byas pas rang gi yul du ma bsdad par gzhan gyi yul du 'phos nas yul gzhan zhig tu bsdad do //
analyzed: rgan mo des mya ngan byas pas rang gi yul du ma bsdad par gzhan gyi yul du 'phos nas yul gzhan zhig tu bsdad do //
translated: The old woman, grieving, did not stay in her own country but moved to another country and stayed there.

original: lo mang po lon nas dus gcig na bu de shin tu ltogs pa sbrang long du song nas pha'i gan du blangs pas pha ngo ma shes te /
analyzed: lo mang po lon nas dus gcig na bu de shin tu ltogs pa sbrang long du song nas pha'i gan du blangs pas pha ngo ma shes te /
translated: After many years had passed, one day the son, who had become very hungry, came to his father.

original: phas ngo shes te bu 'dir shog ces byas pas /
analyzed: phas ngo shes te bu 'dir shog ces byas pas /
translated: The father recognized him and said, “Son, come here!”

original: bu 'jigs pas bros so //
analyzed: bu 'jigs pas bros so //
translated: But the son, frightened, ran away.

original: pha na re pha gi bros pa da'i bu yin //
analyzed: pha na re pha gi bros pa da'i bu yin //
translated: The father said, “That is my son who has run away.

original: 'dir khrid la shog byas pas mis bzung bas bu de brgyal /
analyzed: 'dir khrid la shog byas pas mis bzung bas bu de brgyal /
translated: Bring him here!” The son was seized by the men and fainted.

original: kha nas dbugs kyang ma thon /
analyzed: kha nas dbugs kyang ma thon /
translated: He could not even breathe through his mouth.

original: 'chi ba'i dus la bab pas /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus la bab pas /
translated: The time of his death had come.

original: phas 'di thong cig byas pas bu de langs nas song ngo //
analyzed: phas 'di thong cig byas pas bu de langs nas song ngo //
translated: The father said, “Let him go!” The son got up and left.

original: phyis bu de'i grogs po dang nam zhig tu gnyis bos so //
analyzed: phyis bu de'i grogs po dang nam zhig tu gnyis bos so //
translated: Later, the son’s friends called to him.

original: nam zhig tu bu de yang byung ngo //
analyzed: nam zhig tu bu de yang byung ngo //
translated: One day the son came out.

original: grogs po med par byung ngo //
analyzed: grogs po med par byung ngo //
translated: He had come out without his friends.

original: khyim der yang bsdad do //
analyzed: khyim der yang bsdad do //
translated: He stayed in the house.

original: nam zhig na pha na re khyod bur byang phar bya zer ro //
analyzed: nam zhig na pha na re khyod bur byang phar bya zer ro //
translated: One day the father said, “You are my son.”

original: bu na re rung zer /
analyzed: bu na re rung zer /
translated: The son said, “That is right.”

original: zhag gcig gnyis na lor song nas bu la smras so //
analyzed: zhag gcig gnyis na lor song nas bu la smras so //
translated: One day turned into two days, and then into a year. The father said to the son,

original: rgan po na re tshong dpon phun sum tshogs pa yin zer /
analyzed: rgan po na re tshong dpon phun sum tshogs pa yin zer /
translated: The old man said, “He is a perfect merchant.”

original: yul go sham pa yin /
analyzed: yul go sham pa yin /
translated: “ He is from the country of Gosampa.”🔽“ His son’s name is Stainless.”

original: bu'i ming dri ma med pa yin de zer ba dang bus nga'i pha yin par 'dug / nga'i khyim yin par 'dug sems nas blo brtan @3a * //
analyzed: bu'i ming dri ma med pa yin de zer ba dang bus nga'i pha yin par 'dug / nga'i khyim yin par 'dug sems nas blo brtan @3a * //
translated: “ That is my father,” the boy thought. “ That is my home.”

original: no ; / dpe de bzhin du theg pa gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: no ; / dpe de bzhin du theg pa gcig ces bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is said that there is only one vehicle.

original: de skad byas nas mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: de skad byas nas mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: After saying that, he passed into nirvana.

original: dus ni dpyid zlar ba'i tshes gcig la 'das so //
analyzed: dus ni dpyid zlar ba'i tshes gcig la 'das so //
translated: He passed away on the first day of the first month of spring.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One.

original: rgyal po'i khab ces bya ba ni danda ka'i grong khyer dang / ka ling ka'i grong khyer dang / ma ga dh'a'i grong khyer dang gsum yod pa las /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab ces bya ba ni danda ka'i grong khyer dang / ka ling ka'i grong khyer dang / ma ga dh'a'i grong khyer dang gsum yod pa las /
translated: There were three cities: the city of Dantaka, the city of Kalinka, and the city of Magadha.

original: ma ga dh'a'i grong khyer na drang srong sgom chen cig yod pa la byis pa cig gis gnod pa byas pas /
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i grong khyer na drang srong sgom chen cig yod pa la byis pa cig gis gnod pa byas pas /
translated: In the city of Magadha, a young boy harmed a great meditating sage.

original: drang srong gi kha nas me byung bas /
analyzed: drang srong gi kha nas me byung bas /
translated: Fire came from the sage’s mouth.

original: grong khyer gsum po tshig pas dur khrod gsum du gyur /
analyzed: grong khyer gsum po tshig pas dur khrod gsum du gyur /
translated: The three cities burned and became three charnel grounds.

original: de'i tshe lha'i bu shed las skyes dad shed bu grogs gnyis byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe lha'i bu shed las skyes dad shed bu grogs gnyis byung ste /
translated: At that time, the sons of the gods Śaṃbara and Śambara appeared.

original: 'jig rten gyi mi rnam byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mi rnam byung ste /
translated: People appeared in the world.

original: dang po lha'i zhal zas bdud rtsi za /
analyzed: dang po lha'i zhal zas bdud rtsi za /
translated: At first they ate the nectar food of the gods.

original: gnyis pa bdud rtsis zhag za /
analyzed: gnyis pa bdud rtsis zhag za /
translated: Later they ate the nectar of the earth.

original: de gnyis kyang gsog 'jog gis nub ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang gsog 'jog gis nub ste /
translated: Those two were stored up and disappeared.

original: gsum pa 'bras s'a lu'i ljang ba za /
analyzed: gsum pa 'bras s'a lu'i ljang ba za /
translated: Third, they ate the sprouts of rice.

original: de'i tshe mi rnams 'bras s'a l'u'i ljang pa la ma mthun nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi rnams 'bras s'a l'u'i ljang pa la ma mthun nas /
translated: At that time, people disagreed about the sprouts of rice.

original: mi rnams kyis 'dus nas 'dun ma byas pas /
analyzed: mi rnams kyis 'dus nas 'dun ma byas pas /
translated: The people gathered and held a meeting.

original: 'o cag rnams la dpon po cig dgos par 'dug byas nas yod pas /
analyzed: 'o cag rnams la dpon po cig dgos par 'dug byas nas yod pas /
translated: They said, “We need a leader.”

original: de'i tshe shing cig las sgra byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe shing cig las sgra byung ste /
translated: At that time, a voice came from a tree.

original: shing gi lba ba bcad pas rin po che bee d'urya gdung sha ri ram 'dra ba cig byung /
analyzed: shing gi lba ba bcad pas rin po che bee d'urya gdung sha ri ram 'dra ba cig byung /
translated: “Cut the tree’s goiter. A precious beryl will appear like a piece of meat.”

original: de'i nang nas rgyal po mang pos bkur ba zhes bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i nang nas rgyal po mang pos bkur ba zhes bya ba byung ngo //
translated: From within it, a king called Mahāsudarśana appeared.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni dbu skra aindra n'i la ltar 'dug pa /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni dbu skra aindra n'i la ltar 'dug pa /
translated: His characteristics were that his hair was like sapphire,

original: so dung so 'khor bar 'dug pa /
analyzed: so dung so 'khor bar 'dug pa /
translated: his teeth were like conch shells,🔽and his eyes were like the eyes of a bull.

original: 'gram pa seng ge 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'gram pa seng ge 'dra ba /
translated: His cheeks were like those of a lion.

original: spyan dkar mdangs phyed pa rdzi ma ring ba /
analyzed: spyan dkar mdangs phyed pa rdzi ma ring ba /
translated: His eyes were white and clear, and his eyelashes were long.

original: sku chu zheng gab pa /
analyzed: sku chu zheng gab pa /
translated: His body was well-proportioned.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha byad can cig byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha byad can cig byung ngo //
translated: He was dressed in the attire of a universal monarch.

original: der khrims bcas te /
analyzed: der khrims bcas te /
translated: The king made this rule:

original: mi rnams kyi bsod nams brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi bsod nams brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to examine the merit of men,

original: 'bras s'a lu'i ljang pa bgos so //
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu'i ljang pa bgos so //
translated: the fields of rice were divided up.

original: 'jag ma'i spyil po la me mi btang ba'i khrims bcas so //
analyzed: 'jag ma'i spyil po la me mi btang ba'i khrims bcas so //
translated: The rule was made that no fire was to be lit in the huts of straw.

original: de nas dus nam zhig na /
analyzed: de nas dus nam zhig na /
translated: Then, at one time,

original: rgyal po'i btsun mos me shor bas /
analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mos me shor bas /
translated: the king's queen started a fire.

original: rgyal po na re rang gi khrims rang gis bshig tu mi btub pas /
analyzed: rgyal po na re rang gi khrims rang gis bshig tu mi btub pas /
translated: The king said, I cannot break my own rule.

original: bya rgod phung po'i ri'i nub phyogs su nga'i khyim zhig rtsigs shig gsung ngo //
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ri'i nub phyogs su nga'i khyim zhig rtsigs shig gsung ngo //
translated: Build my house on the western side of Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: de nas brtsigs pas nyin mo brtsigs pa nub mo zhig pa la /
analyzed: de nas brtsigs pas nyin mo brtsigs pa nub mo zhig pa la /
translated: Then, when the house was built, it was destroyed every night after it had been built during the day.

original: rgyal po'i zhal nas nga bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas phyogs bzhir rgyal po'i khab yin no zhes bris shig gsungs /
analyzed: rgyal po'i zhal nas nga bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas phyogs bzhir rgyal po'i khab yin no zhes bris shig gsungs /
translated: The king said, Since my merit is especially exalted, write 'Royal Palace' on the four sides.

original: phyogs bzhir rgyal po'i khab yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir rgyal po'i khab yin no //
translated: It is surrounded by four royal palaces.

original: @3b bris pas mi ma yin gyi gnod pa zhi'o //

analyzed: dri za'i dbang po sa yas bstod cing bsngags mchod pa /

analyzed: mi'am ci'i dbar po 'khor los sgyur bas yas nor bu rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pas bsdu ba /

analyzed: rgya mtsho'i lha sa yas bsdu zhing phyag byas pa /

analyzed: bsod nams dag pa'i nor bu rin po che @6b sa yas shin tu nges par mdzes par byas pa /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i dpal gyi 'od zer sa yas dpal rab tu thal le ba /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i mdzod sna tshogs sa yas mtha' yas par snang ba /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'dzam bu rgyal mtshan sa yas bres pa legs par bzung bas brtan par gyur pa /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che rdo rje seng ge sa yas gzhan gyis mi thub pa bkod pa /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che nyi ma'i snying po sa yas rgya cher spras pa /

translated: It was arrayed with a hundred thousand precious jewels of inconceivable colors. It was arrayed with a hundred thousand wish-fulfilling precious jewels.

analyzed: padma chen po rin po che de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las nges par byung ba /
translated: That great lotus of jewels arose from the roots of merit of the thus-gone ones that transcend the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pas ma nos pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pas ma nos pa /
translated: It was embraced by the bodhisattvas’ intentions.

original: phyogs thams cad du mngon par go bar byed pa /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du mngon par go bar byed pa /

original: sgyu mar gyur pa'i chos las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur pa'i chos las nges par byung ba /
translated: It arose from illusory phenomena.

original: dri nga ba med pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: dri nga ba med pa las skyes pa /
translated: It was born from the absence of foul smells.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi tshul bkod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi tshul bkod pa /
translated: It was arranged in the way of the reality of the absence of afflictions.

original: rmi lam lta bu'i chos nyid kyis kun du rgyu ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i chos nyid kyis kun du rgyu ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi rgyas btab pa /
translated: It was sealed by the reality of the non-composite, which is the movement of the reality that is like a dream.

original: chags pa med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It was endowed with nonattachment.

original: phyogs kun du chos kyi dbyings kyis khyab par byed pa /
analyzed: phyogs kun du chos kyi dbyings kyis khyab par byed pa /
translated: It pervaded the entire realm of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu brjod pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu brjod pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: It was in accord with the expression of the domain of the buddhas.

original: de'i rnam pa dang / yon tan dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang bkod pa'i mtha' ni bskal pa grangs med par yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i padma chen po de la /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang / yon tan dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang bkod pa'i mtha' ni bskal pa grangs med par yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i padma chen po de la /
translated: The extent of the features, qualities, shape, color, and design of that great lotus could not be known even in countless eons.

original: bcom ldan 'das skyil mo krung bcas nas bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skyil mo krung bcas nas bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was seated cross-legged upon it.

original: bcom ldan 'das de chos kyi 'khor lo ni shin tu bskor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de chos kyi 'khor lo ni shin tu bskor /
translated: The Blessed One had turned the wheel of Dharma well.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni shin tu yongs su mthar phyin /🔽ye shes kyi tshogs ni shin tu yongs su rdzogs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni shin tu yongs su mthar phyin / ye shes kyi tshogs ni shin tu yongs su rdzogs /
translated: He had completed his buddha activity well.🔽He had completed the accumulation of wisdom well.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shin tu yongs su bzung /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shin tu yongs su bzung /
translated: He had attained omniscience well.

original: byang chub chen po'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa ni brnyes /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa ni brnyes /
translated: He had attained the perfections and the levels for the sake of great awakening.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i sku ni rab tu 'bar /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i sku ni rab tu 'bar /
translated: His body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and was radiant.

original: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad ni dpe byad bzang pos rnam par spras /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad ni dpe byad bzang pos rnam par spras /
translated: All his major and minor body parts were adorned with the excellent signs.

original: dbu'i gtsug ni sems can thams cad gyis bltar mi mthong /
analyzed: dbu'i gtsug ni sems can thams cad gyis bltar mi mthong /
translated: No being could see the crown of his head.

original: bdud kyi las thams cad ni mkhas /
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad ni mkhas /
translated: He is skilled in all the works of Māra.

original: sems can thams cad kyis ni shes /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis ni shes /
translated: He is known to all sentient beings.

original: spyan rnam pa lnga ni @7a * //
analyzed: spyan rnam pa lnga ni @7a * //
translated: He possesses the five eyes.

original: mnga'/ rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ni ldan /
analyzed: mnga'/ rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ni ldan /
translated: He possesses the supreme of all aspects.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ni ldan /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ni ldan /
translated: He possesses the wisdom of omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ni ldan /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ni ldan /
translated: He possesses all the qualities of a buddha.

original: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba'i tshogs thams cad ni bcom /
analyzed: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba'i tshogs thams cad ni bcom /
translated: He has conquered all the hosts of Māra and adversaries.

original: grags pa dang / sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa ni 'phags /
analyzed: grags pa dang / sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa ni 'phags /
translated: He has attained fame, renown, and praise.

original: khyu mchog dang seng ge'i sgra ni bsgrags /
analyzed: khyu mchog dang seng ge'i sgra ni bsgrags /
translated: He has proclaimed the lion’s roar of the leader of the herd.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa ni kun du bsal /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa ni kun du bsal /
translated: He has dispelled the darkness of ignorance.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med dpag tu med par /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med dpag tu med par /
translated: For countless, innumerable hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons,

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bya dka' ba'i spyod pa las ni phyir ma log / sku ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bya dka' ba'i spyod pa las ni phyir ma log / sku ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: He has not turned back from the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, exertion, meditation, wisdom, means, power, vow, and knowledge, nor from the difficult practices.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan te rab tu mdzes shing /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan te rab tu mdzes shing /
translated: His body is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor characteristics, and is very beautiful.

original: thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa yongs su dag pa yongs su byang ba'o //
analyzed: thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa yongs su dag pa yongs su byang ba'o //
translated: It is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end; it has a good meaning and good words; it is unadulterated, complete, pure, and clear.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Buddha means perfection of abandonment.

original: spyod yul ni dus gsum sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: spyod yul ni dus gsum sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i gnas so //
translated: The domain is the place where the buddhas of the three times appear.

original: rdo rje rin po che'i shid ljon pa rab tu snang ba'i nags tshogs na zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin po che'i shing ljon pas legs par brgyan pa'i dbus na /
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che'i shid ljon pa rab tu snang ba'i nags tshogs na zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin po che'i shing ljon pas legs par brgyan pa'i dbus na /
translated: In the forest grove of the shining trees of the vajra jewel,

original: nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa'o //
translated: he was dwelling together with the assembly of śrāvaka arhats and bodhisattvas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i bar du de dag la sogs pa dge slong nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag gi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i bar du de dag la sogs pa dge slong nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag gi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The one named Venerable Śāriputra, up to the one named Venerable Ānanda, and so forth, those two hundred and fifty bhikṣus,

original: dpen pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshul mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa /
analyzed: dpen pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshul mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa /
translated: their characteristics were that they had realized the way through the nature of solitude,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du gyur pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du gyur pa /
translated: they had actualized the limit of reality,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin la zhugs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin la zhugs pa /
translated: they had entered into the nature of phenomena,

original: srid pa'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba /
translated: they had crossed over the ocean of existence,

original: de bzhin nyid nam mkha' lta bur spyod yul ba /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid nam mkha' lta bur spyod yul ba /
translated: their sphere of activity was like the sky of suchness,

original: kun du spyor ba dang / bag la nyal gyi 'ching ba gcad pa /
analyzed: kun du spyor ba dang / bag la nyal gyi 'ching ba gcad pa /
translated: they had cut the bonds of the latent tendencies and the entanglements,

original: gnas dang rten la ma chags pa /
analyzed: gnas dang rten la ma chags pa /
translated: They are not attached to places or supports.

original: nam mkha' lta bur zhi ba la rnam par rgyu ba /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur zhi ba la rnam par rgyu ba /
translated: They move in the peace that is like space.

original: sangs rgyas la ne ma nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom za ba gcod pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ne ma nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom za ba gcod pa /
translated: They cut through hesitation, doubt, and uncertainty about the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgya mtsho la mos pa'i lam @7b du zhugs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgya mtsho la mos pa'i lam @7b du zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the path of devotion to the ocean of the buddhas’ wisdom.

original: 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered in order to benefit all beings.

original: gsol ba btab par dge ba'i bshes gnyen byed pa /
analyzed: gsol ba btab par dge ba'i bshes gnyen byed pa /
translated: They act as spiritual friends who are asked to do so.

original: sems can thams cad srung bar zhugs pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad srung bar zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered to protect all beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i mdza' bshes su gyur pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i mdza' bshes su gyur pa /
translated: They are friends who do not abandon any being.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i spyod yul las nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i spyod yul las nges par 'byung ba /
translated: They have emerged from the domain of the buddhas’ teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bsrung bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bsrung bar bzhugs pa /
translated: They are present to protect the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa kun du 'dzin par smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa kun du 'dzin par smon lam btab pa /
translated: They have made aspirations to uphold the buddhas’ teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rigs 'byung bar mngon du phyogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rigs 'byung bar mngon du phyogs pa /
translated: They are oriented toward the appearance of the Tathāgata’s family line.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa sha stag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa sha stag go //
translated: all of them had attained the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: bya rgod phung po'i ri dang / dge slong gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs te dang po'o /
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ri dang / dge slong gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs te dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter in the Bodhisattvāvadānakalpalatā, the story of Śāriputra.

original: // / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gi dge 'dun tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gi dge 'dun tshogs pa'o //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One and the assembly of monks were gathered.

original: bcom pa ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: bcom pa ni bzhi'o //
translated: The Blessed One has four aspects.

original: ldan pa ni skal pa drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni skal pa drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The assembly of monks has six aspects.

original: 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is one who has passed beyond suffering.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni nyan thos so //🔽bcas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni nyan thos so // bcas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The assembly of monks refers to the hearers.🔽The Blessed One is one who is endowed with the bodhisattvas.

original: lus 'phags po ni gzugs can snying po'o //
analyzed: lus 'phags po ni gzugs can snying po'o //
translated: The Blessed One is Bimbisāra.

original: yul ma ga dh'a zhes bya ba ni yul dbus so //
analyzed: yul ma ga dh'a zhes bya ba ni yul dbus so //
translated: The Blessed One is the country of Magadha.

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgra zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgra zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One is King Ajātaśatru.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon gyi dus su ma skyes dgra ni sha bar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus su ma skyes dgra ni sha bar skyes pa'o //
translated: In the past, Ajātaśatru was born as a śarabha.

original: gzugs can snying po ni ri khrod du rigs ngan du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can snying po ni ri khrod du rigs ngan du skyes pa'o //
translated: Bimbisāra was born as a low-caste person in the mountains.

original: des ma skyes dgra sha bar skyes pa de la mdas brgyab nas bsad pas /
analyzed: des ma skyes dgra sha bar skyes pa de la mdas brgyab nas bsad pas /
translated: He shot and killed Ajātaśatru, who had been reborn as a deer.

original: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
analyzed: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
translated: As the result of that karma,

original: rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i dgrar 'ongs bsam skyes dgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i dgrar 'ongs bsam skyes dgra zhes bya'o //
translated: he became King Ajātaśatru, who was an enemy of King Bimbisāra.

original: ma ga dha'i bar gyi yul na rgyal po chos skyes la bu mo gnyis yod pa la /
analyzed: ma ga dha'i bar gyi yul na rgyal po chos skyes la bu mo gnyis yod pa la /
translated: In the land of Magadha, there was a king named Dhṛtimān who had two daughters.

original: rgyal po gzugs can snying po dang bu mo chung shas gnyen byas pa la /
analyzed: rgyal po gzugs can snying po dang bu mo chung shas gnyen byas pa la /
translated: King Bimbisāra married the younger daughter.

original: bu mo che shos la gtsug lag khang kun na re 'dis khyo mi rnyed /
analyzed: bu mo che shos la gtsug lag khang kun na re 'dis khyo mi rnyed /
translated: The older daughter was in every temple, saying, “No one will marry me.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyo la phyin kyang bu mo la bu nam skye tsan pha gsod zer bas su yang 'dod pa med pas nu mo na re khyod kyis su la phyin kyang khyo gcig rnyed de 'ongs pas /
analyzed: khyo la phyin kyang bu mo la bu nam skye tsan pha gsod zer bas su yang 'dod pa med pas nu mo na re khyod kyis su la phyin kyang khyo gcig rnyed de 'ongs pas /
translated: When I go to a husband, as soon as a son is born, he will kill his father.” Since no one wanted her, her sister said, “You will find a husband if you go to someone.

original: nga cag gnyis gzugs byad dbyibs dang thams cad 'dra bas /
analyzed: nga cag gnyis gzugs byad dbyibs dang thams cad 'dra bas /
translated: Since we two are alike in appearance and shape,

original: nga gzugs can snying po la thong zer /
analyzed: nga gzugs can snying po la thong zer /
translated: give me to Bimbisāra.”

original: nu mos mnyan nas /
analyzed: nu mos mnyan nas /
translated: Her sister agreed.

original: phu mos nu mor brdzus nas gzugs can snying po la @8a * //
analyzed: phu mos nu mor brdzus nas gzugs can snying po la @8a * //
translated: His elder sister disguised herself as a man and went to Bimbisāra.

original: phyin no // mo la bu skyes bas ma skyes dgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin no // mo la bu skyes bas ma skyes dgra zhes bya'o //
translated: Since she gave birth to a son, he was called Ajātaśatru.

original: de'i pha ni rgyal po gzugs can snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i pha ni rgyal po gzugs can snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: His father was the king called Bimbisāra.

original: de la pho brang bee d'urya rang shel bya ba yod pa /
analyzed: de la pho brang bee d'urya rang shel bya ba yod pa /
translated: He had a palace called Vaidūrya Crystal.

original: mchod gnas su yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pas /
analyzed: mchod gnas su yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pas /
translated: The perfect Buddha Śākyamuni was his object of worship.

original: bdud lhas byin gyis phrag dog byed pas /
analyzed: bdud lhas byin gyis phrag dog byed pas /
translated: Because of his envy, Devadatta

original: gzugs can snying po'i bu ma skyes dgra la khyod dang rgyal po gzugs can snying po gnyis /
analyzed: gzugs can snying po'i bu ma skyes dgra la khyod dang rgyal po gzugs can snying po gnyis /
translated: said to Bimbisāra’s son Ajātaśatru, “You and King Bimbisāra

original: yab sras bzang ngan med pa yin la /
analyzed: yab sras bzang ngan med pa yin la /
translated: are not good and bad father and son.

original: pho brang bee d'urya rang shel kyang khyod la mi ster /
analyzed: pho brang bee d'urya rang shel kyang khyod la mi ster /
translated: He will not give you the Vaidūrya Crystal Palace.

original: kho'i mchod gnas kyang goo tam la byas /
analyzed: kho'i mchod gnas kyang goo tam la byas /
translated: He has made Gautama his object of worship.”

original: lha sbyin na reng dang goo ta ma gnyis yab kyis ma phye yum gyis ma phye ba yin pa la /
analyzed: lha sbyin na reng dang goo ta ma gnyis yab kyis ma phye yum gyis ma phye ba yin pa la /
translated: Devadatta said, “Gautama and I were not separated by our father or mother.

original: gzugs can snying pos goo ta ma'i yon bdag byas /
analyzed: gzugs can snying pos goo ta ma'i yon bdag byas /
translated: Bimbisāra has made Gautama his benefactor.

original: nga la yon bdag byas pa med /
analyzed: nga la yon bdag byas pa med /
translated: I have no patron.

original: khyod la yang mchod gnas dang pho brang med /
analyzed: khyod la yang mchod gnas dang pho brang med /
translated: You have no priest or palace.

original: ngas goo ta ma gsad /
analyzed: ngas goo ta ma gsad /
translated: I will kill Gautama.

original: khyod kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po sod ngas mchod gnas bya khyod kyis yon bdag bya byas pas /
analyzed: khyod kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po sod ngas mchod gnas bya khyod kyis yon bdag bya byas pas /
translated: You kill King Bimbisāra. I will be your priest. You be my patron.”

original: ma skyes dgras bdud lhas byin la nyan nas /
analyzed: ma skyes dgras bdud lhas byin la nyan nas /
translated: Ajātaśatru listened to Devadatta’s words.

original: 'khor pa dang blon po rnams pos nas /
analyzed: 'khor pa dang blon po rnams pos nas /
translated: He told his retinue and ministers,

original: nga'i yab zung shig byas pas /
analyzed: nga'i yab zung shig byas pas /
translated: “Bind my father.”

original: 'khor ba dang blon pos yab bzung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang blon pos yab bzung ngo //
translated: His retinue and ministers bound the king.

original: ma skyes dgras yab kyi rkang mthil bshus nas /
analyzed: ma skyes dgras yab kyi rkang mthil bshus nas /
translated: Ajātaśatru tore off the soles of his father’s feet,

original: 'bras ma bgrus pa'i gseb nas drud bshal byas nas yab ma 'das par dong du bcug nas gsangs nas gzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras ma bgrus pa'i gseb nas drud bshal byas nas yab ma 'das par dong du bcug nas gsangs nas gzhag go //
translated: and dragged him by the hair through the unhusked rice, and then threw him into a pit. He sealed it up and left.

original: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgra'i yum gyis bza' ba drung bag re bskyal lo //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgra'i yum gyis bza' ba drung bag re bskyal lo //
translated: Then the mother of King Ajātaśatru brought him food and drink.

original: de nas bdud lhas byin gyis kyang rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer bar gyi steng nas lcags kyi rdo'i 'khrul 'khor bcas nas gzhag go //
analyzed: de nas bdud lhas byin gyis kyang rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer bar gyi steng nas lcags kyi rdo'i 'khrul 'khor bcas nas gzhag go //
translated: Then Devadatta set up an iron machine on top of the city wall of Rājagṛha.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor nyan thos dang bcas nas bsod snyoms mdzad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor nyan thos dang bcas nas bsod snyoms mdzad nas /
translated: The Blessed One, together with his retinue of śrāvakas, was having his alms meal.

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi grong bar na yar byon pa la /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi grong bar na yar byon pa la /
translated: He was proceeding through the town of Rājagṛha.

original: lhas byin gyis 'khrul 'khor thag pa bcad pas rdo'i char drag po phab pas /
analyzed: lhas byin gyis 'khrul 'khor thag pa bcad pas rdo'i char drag po phab pas /
translated: Devadatta cut the ropes of the machine, causing a heavy rain of stones to fall.

original: de'i dbus su gnod spyan rgyud la phog pas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su gnod spyan rgyud la phog pas /
translated: In the middle of that, a stone struck the Buddha on the toe of his right foot.

original: gnod sbyin shi nas lha'i bur skyes so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin shi nas lha'i bur skyes so //
translated: The yakṣa died and was reborn as a god.

original: rdo ba yar ma gcig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs g-yas pa'i mtheb rtsa las khrag dbyung ngo //
analyzed: rdo ba yar ma gcig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs g-yas pa'i mtheb rtsa las khrag dbyung ngo //
translated: One stone drew blood from the Blessed One's right toe.

original: khrag byung pas 'jig rten gyi mi rnams na re bcom ldan 'das kyi sku lus rdo rje'i phung po yin zer ba @8b mi bden zer bas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal nas sngon rigs ngan du skyes pa'i dus su ri dgas gcig la brgyab pas de'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin gsungs so //
analyzed: khrag byung pas 'jig rten gyi mi rnams na re bcom ldan 'das kyi sku lus rdo rje'i phung po yin zer ba @8b mi bden zer bas / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal nas sngon rigs ngan du skyes pa'i dus su ri dgas gcig la brgyab pas de'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin gsungs so //
translated: Because blood flowed, the people of the world said, What the Blessed One said about his body being a vajra aggregate is not true.🔽The Blessed One said, In the past, when I was born into a low caste, I shot a deer. That is the ripening of that karma.

original: de nas ma skyes dgra nga'i bu'i lag ngar la /
analyzed: de nas ma skyes dgra nga'i bu'i lag ngar la /
translated: Then Ajātaśatru said, If the Blessed One is not free from the ripening of karma,

original: thor pa gcig la khrag byung bas /🔽ma skyes dgra'i khas 'jibs nas bor nas sas g-yogs so //
analyzed: thor pa gcig la khrag byung bas / ma skyes dgra'i khas 'jibs nas bor nas sas g-yogs so //
translated: One of the boils became infected and bled.

original: de mthod  nas ma skyes dgra'i ma dgod do //
analyzed: de mthod  nas ma skyes dgra'i ma dgod do //
translated: Ajatashatru sucked the blood from it and then threw the boil away and covered it with dirt.

original: ma skyes dgra na re de phan chod du yum bshum pa la /
analyzed: ma skyes dgra na re de phan chod du yum bshum pa la /
translated: When she saw that, Ajatashatru's mother laughed.🔽Ajatashatru said, My mother has been crying up until now.

original: de ring yum dgyes pa de ci las dgyes pa yin zhes dris pas /
analyzed: de ring yum dgyes pa de ci las dgyes pa yin zhes dris pas /
translated: Why is she laughing today?

original: man re sngon khyod kyi lag pa la yang thor pa gcig byung nas /
analyzed: man re sngon khyod kyi lag pa la yang thor pa gcig byung nas /
translated: She said, Before, you had a boil on your hand.

original: yab rgyal po gzugs can snying pos kyang khrag de khyod kyis mthong na brgyal gyis dogs nas 'thungs pas med pa de dran pas bzhad pa yin gsung ngo //
analyzed: yab rgyal po gzugs can snying pos kyang khrag de khyod kyis mthong na brgyal gyis dogs nas 'thungs pas med pa de dran pas bzhad pa yin gsung ngo //
translated: Because King Bimbisara feared that if you saw the blood you would faint, he drank it. I am laughing because I remember that.🔽Then King Ajatashatru thought, My father was so kind to me, but I did such terrible things to him.

original: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgra des yab 'di 'dra ba'i drin can yin par 'dug pa la ngas ma legs pa 'di 'dra ba byas so snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes nas yab dong nang nas bton la bsnyen bkur bya bsams nas phyin pas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgra des yab 'di 'dra ba'i drin can yin par 'dug pa la ngas ma legs pa 'di 'dra ba byas so snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes nas yab dong nang nas bton la bsnyen bkur bya bsams nas phyin pas /
translated: He felt remorse and wanted to take his father out of the pit and honor him. He went to the pit.

original: yab kyis ma skyes dgra'i skad grag par thos nas /
analyzed: yab kyis ma skyes dgra'i skad grag par thos nas /
translated: His father heard the sound of Ajātaśatru’s voice.

original: khos mtshon brgyab nas nga gsod par byung snyam nas /
analyzed: khos mtshon brgyab nas nga gsod par byung snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, “He has come to kill me with his weapon,”

original: yab kyi snying gas nas 'das so //
analyzed: yab kyi snying gas nas 'das so //
translated: his heart burst and he died.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams steg pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams steg pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to make his roots of virtue, the Blessed Buddha, the śrāvakas, and the bodhisattvas

original: na bza' dad zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / 'khor rnam bzhi dus dus su na bza' gsol ba'o //
analyzed: na bza' dad zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / 'khor rnam bzhi dus dus su na bza' gsol ba'o //
translated: “robes” means that from time to time the Perfectly Awakened One and the four retinues put on robes.

original: gzims cha dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzims cha dang zhes pa ni /
translated: “Beds” means

original: de yang dus dus su gzims cha la sogs pa 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dus dus su gzims cha la sogs pa 'bul ba'o //
translated: that from time to time they offer beds and so forth.

original: snyun gyi gsos sman dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun de dag la /
analyzed: snyun gyi gsos sman dang zhes bya ba ni / sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun de dag la /
translated: “Medicines for curing illness” means

original: gso ba'i yo byad rtag tu 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: gso ba'i yo byad rtag tu 'bul ba'o //
translated: that they always offer articles for curing the Buddha and so forth, the saṅgha of monks.

original: yo byad rnams kyis ni bkur sti byas /
analyzed: yo byad rnams kyis ni bkur sti byas /
translated: “With articles” means that they are honored.

original: rtag tu lus ngag yid gsum dad par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu lus ngag yid gsum dad par bya'o //
translated: They should always have faith with their body, speech, and mind.

original: bla mar bya ba ni gong nas gong du dam par khur ba'o //
analyzed: bla mar bya ba ni gong nas gong du dam par khur ba'o //
translated: To venerate means to carry the holy one higher and higher.

original: bsti stang byas nas ni /
analyzed: bsti stang byas nas ni /
translated: Having honored,

original: de bas kyang lhag pa med par khur ba'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang lhag pa med par khur ba'o //
translated: to carry even more than that.

original: mchod pa byas pa'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang 'khor rnams la sogs pa /
analyzed: mchod pa byas pa'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang 'khor rnams la sogs pa /
translated: To worship means to worship the buddhas and retinues and so forth.

original: dus dus su rtag tu mchod pa'o //
analyzed: dus dus su rtag tu mchod pa'o //
translated: To do so from time to time is to worship constantly.

original: yang de'i ches yang cher g-yas par gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang de'i ches yang cher g-yas par gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it says, “it became even more right.”

original: sa chen po 'di rnam pa @9a * //
analyzed: sa chen po 'di rnam pa @9a * //
translated: This great earth shook

original: drug tu g-yos /🔽rab tu g-yos kun du rab tu g-yos /
analyzed: drug tu g-yos / rab tu g-yos kun du rab tu g-yos /
translated: in six ways.

original: 'gul rab tu 'gul /🔽kun du rab tu 'gul /🔽ldeg rab tu ldeg / kun du rab tu ldeg go //
analyzed: 'gul rab tu 'gul / kun du rab tu 'gul / ldeg rab tu ldeg / kun du rab tu ldeg go //
translated: It shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely.🔽It trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.

original: chem chem / rab tu chem chem /🔽kun du rab tu chem chem /🔽'ur 'ur rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: chem chem / rab tu chem chem / kun du rab tu chem chem / 'ur 'ur rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: It quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.🔽It rumbled, rumbled strongly, and rumbled intensely.

original: kun du rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: kun du rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: It roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely.

original: shig shig / rab tu shig shig / kun du rab tu shig shig ste /
analyzed: shig shig / rab tu shig shig / kun du rab tu shig shig ste /
translated: It rattled, rattled strongly, and rattled intensely.

original: ltas chen po bco brgyad byung ba'o //
analyzed: ltas chen po bco brgyad byung ba'o //
translated: These are the eighteen great signs.

original: ltas chen po bco brgyad po de dag gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ltas chen po bco brgyad po de dag gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen great signs?

original: mu ge dang / mi nad dang / phyugs dag dang / yams kyi nad dang / 'brum bu'i nad gsum dang / rims nad dang / rlung nad dang ; mkhris pa'i nad dang / bad kan dang 'dus pa'i nad dang mdze dang lhog pa dang /
analyzed: mu ge dang / mi nad dang / phyugs dag dang / yams kyi nad dang / 'brum bu'i nad gsum dang / rims nad dang / rlung nad dang ; mkhris pa'i nad dang / bad kan dang 'dus pa'i nad dang mdze dang lhog pa dang /
translated: famine, human illness, cattle disease, epidemics, the three fevers, contagious fevers, wind illness, bile illness, phlegm illness, and combined illnesses, leprosy, epilepsy,

original: me dpal dang / nad de dag la sogs pa sa g-yos pas byung ngo //
analyzed: me dpal dang / nad de dag la sogs pa sa g-yos pas byung ngo //
translated: and those illnesses and so on arose from the disturbance.

original: sprin 'dus pa chen po yang byung zhes bya ba ni ma rungs ba 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin 'dus pa chen po yang byung zhes bya ba ni ma rungs ba 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A great gathering of clouds also arose means that it rained in an unruly way.

original: ci'i phyir ma rungs pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rungs pa zhe na /
translated: Why was it unruly?

original: me tshan gyi char chen po 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tshan gyi char chen po 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it rained a great rain of hot coals.

original: dus ma yin par rlung zhes bya ba ni nad thams cad byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽ser ba chen po ni mu ge chen po byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ma yin par rlung zhes bya ba ni nad thams cad byung ba'i phyir ro // ser ba chen po ni mu ge chen po byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The untimely wind means that all illnesses arose.🔽The great hail means that a great famine arose.

original: sprin chen po las char pa yang 'bab par gyur zhes bya ba ni skyi 'dang sman dang gi char chen po bab nas lo nyes byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin chen po las char pa yang 'bab par gyur zhes bya ba ni skyi 'dang sman dang gi char chen po bab nas lo nyes byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And rain fell from the great clouds means that a great rain of hail fell, and because of that, there was a bad harvest.

original: 'brug kyang de ri ri zer zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'jigs pa'i sgra byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brug kyang de ri ri zer zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'jigs pa'i sgra byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The thunder is the sound of fear in the sky.

original: glog rnams kyang byung zhes bya ba ni yangs pa can gyi mi rnams gcig la gcig ma mthong nas skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog rnams kyang byung zhes bya ba ni yangs pa can gyi mi rnams gcig la gcig ma mthong nas skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lightning is the fear of the people of Vaishali, not seeing each other.

original: phyogs bcu yang 'khrugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni yangs pa can gyi mi rnams brgyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu yang 'khrugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni yangs pa can gyi mi rnams brgyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The turmoil in the ten directions is the people of Vaishali fainting.

original: mun pa mun nag ces bya ba ni mi rnams gcig la gcig ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag ces bya ba ni mi rnams gcig la gcig ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The darkness is not seeing each other.

original: chen po yang byung zhes bya ba ni mi bzad pa'i mun pas 'od rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po yang byung zhes bya ba ni mi bzad pa'i mun pas 'od rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great darkness is the light being overwhelmed by unbearable darkness.

original: skar ma dang nyi ma dang zla ba mi snang zhing 'od dang mi ldan pa ni /
analyzed: skar ma dang nyi ma dang zla ba mi snang zhing 'od dang mi ldan pa ni /
translated: The stars, sun, and moon do not appear and are not luminous,

original: mun pa'i sprin chen pos bkab pa'o /
analyzed: mun pa'i sprin chen pos bkab pa'o /
translated: covered by a great dark cloud.

original: lhan mer ma yin /
analyzed: lhan mer ma yin /
translated: Not shining,

original: lhar nger ma yin zhing 'od mi gsal bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni 'od rnams mi 'byung zhing gzi brjid mi gsal bas te /
analyzed: lhar nger ma yin zhing 'od mi gsal bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni 'od rnams mi 'byung zhing gzi brjid mi gsal bas te /
translated: They were not certain to be gods, and their light became dim.

original: shes rab can rnams shes rab dang bral bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab can rnams shes rab dang bral bar gyur ba'o //
translated: The wise became devoid of wisdom.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore means

original: de rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi nus @9b mthu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi nus @9b mthu bstan pa'o //
translated: that the power of their miracles was shown.

original: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen por 'jigs pa de dag byung ba ni /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen por 'jigs pa de dag byung ba ni /
translated: The fear that arose in the great city of Vaiśālī

original: litstsha b'i 'byung bos btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: litstsha b'i 'byung bos btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: was caused by the arising of the Licchavi people.

original: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer zhes bya ba ni yul dbus nyid do //
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer zhes bya ba ni yul dbus nyid do //
translated: The great city of Vaiśālī is the very center of the country.

original: li tstsha b'i kha cig gis grong gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i grong khyer la bya'o //
analyzed: li tstsha b'i kha cig gis grong gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i grong khyer la bya'o //
translated: Some Licchavi people in another city refers to the city of the brahmins.

original: grong khyer gang yin ba de zhes bya ba ni ma ga dh'a dang bram ze'i grong gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: grong khyer gang yin ba de zhes bya ba ni ma ga dh'a dang bram ze'i grong gnyis la bya'o //
translated: The city that is called that refers to both Magadha and the city of the brahmins.

original: gdon 'byung pos btab par gyur ces bya ba ni grong khyer de gnyis ka'i mi rnams la 'byung po'i nad sna tshogs byung bas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon 'byung pos btab par gyur ces bya ba ni grong khyer de gnyis ka'i mi rnams la 'byung po'i nad sna tshogs byung bas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Seized by demons” means that the people of those two cities were frightened by various demonic illnesses.

original: grong gi gzhon nu rnams zhes bya ba ni rtsis mkhan dang ni gtsug lag mkhan pos mi zin pa /
analyzed: grong gi gzhon nu rnams zhes bya ba ni rtsis mkhan dang ni gtsug lag mkhan pos mi zin pa /
translated: “Young men of the city” means that the astrologers and the masters of the scriptures could not calculate it.

original: mig rno dang mo ma rnams kyis kyang mo mi zin pa'o //
analyzed: mig rno dang mo ma rnams kyis kyang mo mi zin pa'o //
translated: The diviners and the fortune-tellers could not divine it.

original: blon po dang ni blon pos kyang rgyal po la zhu ba phul mi nus shing nad kyis btab pa'o //
analyzed: blon po dang ni blon pos kyang rgyal po la zhu ba phul mi nus shing nad kyis btab pa'o //
translated: “The ministers and the chief ministers” means that they could not present a petition to the king, and they were afflicted by illness.

original: blon po chen po dang ni gong bzhin du'o //
analyzed: blon po chen po dang ni gong bzhin du'o //
translated: “The great ministers” means as before.

original: 'khor dang gnas dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / mngag pa dang / g-yog kha cig kyang gdon zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams kyis btab nas /
analyzed: 'khor dang gnas dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / mngag pa dang / g-yog kha cig kyang gdon zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams kyis btab nas /
translated: “Some of the retinue, the residents, the male servants, the female servants, the workers, the employees, and the attendants were seized by demons” means that they were afflicted by evil spirits.

original: dran pa stor ba dang / smyo ba dang / yams nad dang / rims nad dang / 'brum bu dang / lhog pa la sogs pa'i nad ma rungs pa mang po byung ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa stor ba dang / smyo ba dang / yams nad dang / rims nad dang / 'brum bu dang / lhog pa la sogs pa'i nad ma rungs pa mang po byung ba'o //
translated: There were many terrible diseases such as loss of memory, insanity, plague, fever, smallpox, and epilepsy.

original: 'byung pos btab par gyur zhes bya ba yan chod ni /
analyzed: 'byung pos btab par gyur zhes bya ba yan chod ni /
translated: Up to afflicted by spirits means

original: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / yi dags dang / 'byung po dang / sha za la sogs pa rnams bram ze li tstsha b'is bskrad pas ma thub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / yi dags dang / 'byung po dang / sha za la sogs pa rnams bram ze li tstsha b'is bskrad pas ma thub pa'i phyir //
translated: because the Licchavi Brahmins were unable to drive away the nagas, yakshas, pretas, bhutas, rakshasas, and so forth,

original: grong de'i mi rnams la nad sna tshogs byung ba'i phyir 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: grong de'i mi rnams la nad sna tshogs byung ba'i phyir 'jigs pa'o //
translated: various diseases arose in the people of that town, so it is frightening.

original: yul yangs pa can gyi ljongs /
analyzed: yul yangs pa can gyi ljongs /
translated: In the country of Vaishali,

original: kun gyi dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la dad pas skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: kun gyi dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la dad pas skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: all the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, who had faith in the Three Jewels and gone for refuge,

original: skyi bung zhes bya ba ni drag tu 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyi bung zhes bya ba ni drag tu 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: were terrified because of the severe fear.

original: 'jigs skrag sngangs te skyi bung zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la dad par byed pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'jigs skrag sngangs te skyi bung zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la dad par byed pa rnams kyang /
translated: The line terrified, with hair standing on end refers to those who have faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal thos nas sems stong nas lus 'dar bar gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal thos nas sems stong nas lus 'dar bar gyur te /
translated: When they hear about the suffering of sentient beings, their minds become empty and their bodies tremble.

original: ngag gis kyang bzlas pa la sogs pa mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis kyang bzlas pa la sogs pa mi nus pa'o //
translated: They are unable to recite mantras and so forth.

original: kha gnam du bltas shing du 'bod do zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa'i ser ba dang char @10a * //
analyzed: kha gnam du bltas shing du 'bod do zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa'i ser ba dang char @10a * //
translated: The line looking up to the sky, they cry out refers to the fear of untimely hail and rain

original: pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'bab pas 'jigs pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni gus par de rnams kyis kyang 'jigs skrag byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'bab pas 'jigs pa'o // sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni gus par de rnams kyis kyang 'jigs skrag byung ba'i phyir /
translated: falling in various ways.🔽The line they pay homage to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha means that because they are frightened,

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: they pay homage to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: bra ma ze'i khyim dag ces bya ba nas mchod rten gyi gnas na gnas pa dag la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni lta ba log pa'i phyir rang dad pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal bas mun nag zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bra ma ze'i khyim dag ces bya ba nas mchod rten gyi gnas na gnas pa dag la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni lta ba log pa'i phyir rang dad pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal bas mun nag zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who dwell in the homes of the Brahmins and the Vaishyas refers to those who dwell in the places of the stupas. They are bowed to because they have wrong views, and because they pay homage to their own gods of faith, in order to pacify the darkness.

original: gang dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mngon par ma dad pa'i bram ze dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mi rigs mi gcig pa /
analyzed: gang dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mngon par ma dad pa'i bram ze dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mi rigs mi gcig pa /
translated: The phrase those Brahmins who have no faith in the teachings of the Perfectly Awakened One refers to those who are not of the same caste as the world.

original: mu stegs kyi chos la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi chos la dga' ba ste /
translated: They are fond of the teachings of the non-Buddhists.

original: de rnams kyang lta ba mi gcig pa sum brgya drug cu po yang /
analyzed: de rnams kyang lta ba mi gcig pa sum brgya drug cu po yang /
translated: They also have three hundred and sixty different views.

original: de las bsdus pa drug ste /
analyzed: de las bsdus pa drug ste /
translated: Those are summarized into six.

original: snying rje med cing gab pa dang / dgra bcom pa dang / byol song la gus pa dang / khrus chog dang ; dka' thub dang / dge sbyong dang drug go //
analyzed: snying rje med cing gab pa dang / dgra bcom pa dang / byol song la gus pa dang / khrus chog dang ; dka' thub dang / dge sbyong dang drug go //
translated: They are the lack of compassion, secrecy, arhatship, devotion to animals, ablution, austerities, and asceticism.

original: de las bsdus pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las bsdus pa gnyis te /
translated: Those are summarized into two.

original: rtag chad gnyis so //
analyzed: rtag chad gnyis so //
translated: They are eternalism and nihilism.

original: khyim bdag de dag kha cig ni tshangs pa la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rtag par lta zhing tshangs pa la gus pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag de dag kha cig ni tshangs pa la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rtag par lta zhing tshangs pa la gus pa'o //
translated: Some of those householders said, We pay homage to Brahma, meaning they were devoted to Brahma while viewing him as permanent.

original: kha cig ni brgya byin la zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la lta zhing 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la lta ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni brgya byin la zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la lta zhing 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la lta ba'o //
translated: Some said, We pay homage to Indra, meaning they viewed the sufferings of cyclic existence and the five sense objects.

original: kha cig ni 'jig rten skyong ba la phyag 'tshal zhes pa ni dbang dang mtho ris thob par 'dod pas tshe 'di dang phyi ma la bsrung ba dang / skyob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig rten skyong ba la phyag 'tshal zhes pa ni dbang dang mtho ris thob par 'dod pas tshe 'di dang phyi ma la bsrung ba dang / skyob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Some said, We pay homage to the world guardians, meaning they desired protection and refuge in this and future lives, desiring power and high status.

original: kha cig ni dbang phyug chen po dang zhes pa ni dka' thub tu gnas pa yod par lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang phyug chen po dang zhes pa ni dka' thub tu gnas pa yod par lta ba rnams so //
translated: Some said, We pay homage to Mahesvara, meaning those who view existence as asceticism.

original: khyim bdag ni so so'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag ni so so'i lta ba'o //
translated: The householders have individual views.

original: nor bu bzang po dang ni rtag par 'dod pa nor gyi don la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: nor bu bzang po dang ni rtag par 'dod pa nor gyi don la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Good Jewel and those who desire permanence are those who abide in the pursuit of wealth.

original: gang ba bzang po dang / 'phrog ma dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang phyi ma la phun sum tshogs pa rtag par lta ba'o//
analyzed: gang ba bzang po dang / 'phrog ma dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang phyi ma la phun sum tshogs pa rtag par lta ba'o//
translated: are those who always view the perfection of this world and the next.

original: nyi ma dang ni zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nyi ma dang ni zhes pa ni /
translated: “Sun”

original: chad par lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: chad par lta ba rnams so //
translated: refers to those who hold the view of annihilation.🔽“Moon”

original: zla ba dang ni zhes pa ni bar ma de'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang ni zhes pa ni bar ma de'i lta ba'o //
translated: refers to the views in between.🔽“Stars”

original: skar ma dang ni zhes pa ni gnyis la gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skar ma dang ni zhes pa ni gnyis la gtogs pa'o //
translated: refers to those who belong to both.🔽“Planets”

original: gza' dang zhes pa ni mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i lta bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gza' dang zhes pa ni mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i lta bar gnas pa'o //
translated: refers to those who hold views that are both compatible and incompatible.🔽“Mountains, forests, medicinal herbs, trees, rivers, ponds, lakes, lotus ponds, and the abodes of stūpas”

original: ri dang nags tshogs dang / sman dang / ljon @10b shing dang / klung dang / lteng ka dang / mtshe'u dang / rdzing bu dang / mchod rten gyi gnas na gnas pa dag la phyag 'tshal zhing zhes pa ni lta ba gci ka pa de rnams /
analyzed: ri dang nags tshogs dang / sman dang / ljon @10b shing dang / klung dang / lteng ka dang / mtshe'u dang / rdzing bu dang / mchod rten gyi gnas na gnas pa dag la phyag 'tshal zhing zhes pa ni lta ba gci ka pa de rnams /
translated: refers to those who pay homage to those views.

original: gnas de rnams su phyin nas /
analyzed: gnas de rnams su phyin nas /
translated: Having gone to those abodes,

original: dam bdar ba dang / smon lam la sogs pa 'debs pa'o / bdag cag ni 'di 'dra ba'i gnod pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nas ji ltar thar bar 'gyur snyam du sems shing 'khod pa dag ces bya ba ni so so'i lta ba mi gcig pa'i lha rnams la /
analyzed: dam bdar ba dang / smon lam la sogs pa 'debs pa'o / bdag cag ni 'di 'dra ba'i gnod pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nas ji ltar thar bar 'gyur snyam du sems shing 'khod pa dag ces bya ba ni so so'i lta ba mi gcig pa'i lha rnams la /
translated: They are thinking, How can we be freed from this place of fear, this kind of harm?

original: de skad du smras nas rang gi yi dam la gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du smras nas rang gi yi dam la gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: Having spoken thus, they supplicate their own tutelary deities.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Blessed One has been explained.

original: grong khyer yangs pa can gyi mun pa 'byung ba'i gnas skabs te gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: grong khyer yangs pa can gyi mun pa 'byung ba'i gnas skabs te gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter on the origin of darkness in the city of Vaiśālī.

original: // / spyan rnam par dag pas gzigs zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'i spyan gyis sems can la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: // / spyan rnam par dag pas gzigs zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'i spyan gyis sems can la gzigs pa'o //
translated: Seeing with pure eyes means seeing sentient beings with the eyes of compassion.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One...

original: mngon par 'du mdzad do zhes bya ba yan chod ni dam pa'i chos mngon par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad do zhes bya ba yan chod ni dam pa'i chos mngon par bshad pa yin te /
translated: up to manifests is the explanation of the true Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni gling bzhi bye ba phrag brgyar sprul ba'i sku bye ba phrag brgyar sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni gling bzhi bye ba phrag brgyar sprul ba'i sku bye ba phrag brgyar sprul pa'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One said, The so-called miracle is the manifestation of a billion emanation bodies in a billion four-continent worlds.

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pas mngon par 'du mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gang gis 'dul bde la de dang de'i ngo bor snang ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pas mngon par 'du mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gang gis 'dul bde la de dang de'i ngo bor snang ba'o //
translated: The so-called manifestation through intention is the appearance in various forms to those to be tamed by various means.

original: de tsug yin par ci shes na /
analyzed: de tsug yin par ci shes na /
translated: How do we know that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las /
translated: In the words of the Blessed One:

original: gang la gang 'dul de la de ston pa //
analyzed: gang la gang 'dul de la de ston pa //
translated: To those to be tamed by whatever, I show that to them.

original: ston pa'i glang po khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ston pa'i glang po khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, the elephant among teachers!

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Regarding the expression a great billionfold world system of three-thousand worlds, the Blessed One said:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ni gsum ste /
translated: A world system is of three kinds:

original: nyi zla stong /🔽gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas pa stong /
analyzed: nyi zla stong / gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas pa stong /
translated: a thousand suns and moons,🔽a thousand four-continent worlds with Mount Meru,

original: rgyal chen rigs bzhi nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du stong spyi phud do //
analyzed: rgyal chen rigs bzhi nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du stong spyi phud do //
translated: and a thousand worlds of the Four Great Kings up to the world of Brahma are called a 'small chiliocosm.'

original: de stong la stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi kham so //🔽stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong la /
analyzed: de stong la stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi kham so // stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong la /
translated: One thousand of those is called a “second middling dichiliocosm.”

original: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi kham chen po'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi kham chen po'o //
translated: One thousand of those is called a “great trichiliocosm.”🔽The world with its gods, humans, and asuras became filled with light.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dad par gyur te zhes bya ba ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum ste /🔽ma dad pa dad par byed pa'i cho 'phrul dang / kun rjod par byed pa'i cho 'phrul gsum gyis dad pa smin par byed pa'i @11a * //

translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras became filled with light means that the world with its gods, humans, and asuras became filled with light through the three kinds of miracles.

original: cho 'phrul dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha dang mi'i bar du 'dun par bcas pa'o //🔽de nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cho 'phrul dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha dang mi'i bar du 'dun par bcas pa'o // de nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras became filled with light through the three kinds of miracles means that the world with its gods, humans, and asuras became filled with light through the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of supernormal power, the miracle of instruction, and the miracle of transformation.🔽Then, the Blessed One, having filled the world with its gods, humans, and asuras with light through the three kinds of miracles,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba 'dun par mdzad pa de nas /🔽mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i lha ste /
