original: tshangs pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Great Brahma.

original: tshe tshad bskal ba drug cu thub /
analyzed: tshe tshad bskal ba drug cu thub /
translated: His life-span is sixty eons.

original: lus dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis /
analyzed: lus dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis /
translated: His body is one and a half yojanas.

original: 'di man chad bsam gtan dang po'i rtog dpyod me dang 'dra bas me yis 'jig /'di yang bsam gtan dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad bsam gtan dang po'i rtog dpyod me dang 'dra bas me yis 'jig /'di yang bsam gtan dang po ste /
translated: From here on, the first concentration is destroyed by the fire of the investigation and analysis that are like fire. This is also the first concentration.

original: tshang ba mdun na 'don gyi nges tsheg gong ma'i tshangs pa chen po'i spyan snga na /
analyzed: tshang ba mdun na 'don gyi nges tsheg gong ma'i tshangs pa chen po'i spyan snga na /
translated: In front of the Great Brahma of the higher realm,

original: 'og ma 'gro drug gi las dge sdig gi smrang 'don pas /
analyzed: 'og ma 'gro drug gi las dge sdig gi smrang 'don pas /
translated: the Reciter of Brahma recites the accounts of the virtuous and non-virtuous actions of the six beings of the lower realm.

original: tshangs pa mdun na 'don zhes bya'o //🔽yang na tshangs pa chen po la phan 'dogs pas tshangs ba nye phan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mdun na 'don zhes bya'o // yang na tshangs pa chen po la phan 'dogs pas tshangs ba nye phan zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Reciter of Brahma.🔽Alternatively, he is called the Brahma Attendant because he benefits the Great Brahma.

original: yang na tshangs pa chen po la 'khor bas tshangs 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa chen po la 'khor bas tshangs 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: Or he is called the Brahma Assembly because he circles around the Great Brahma.

original: tshe tshad bskal ba bzhi bcu thub /
analyzed: tshe tshad bskal ba bzhi bcu thub /
translated: His life-span is forty eons.

original: lus dpag tshad gcig go //
analyzed: lus dpag tshad gcig go //
translated: His body is one yojana.

original: 'di yang bsam gtan dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di yang bsam gtan dang po ste /
translated: This is also the first concentration.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha'i nges tshig 'og ma'i 'dod pa khams kyi 'khor ba gyod 'khrin 'dra ba las ni tshangs bas tshangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha'i nges tshig 'og ma'i 'dod pa khams kyi 'khor ba gyod 'khrin 'dra ba las ni tshangs bas tshangs pa chen po'o //
translated: The Brahmakayika gods are so called because they are the great Brahmas, the ones who are free from the disputes of the lower desire realm.

original: 'khor du tshangs ris tshe'i tshad bskal pa nyi shu thub lus dpag tshad phyed do //
analyzed: 'khor du tshangs ris tshe'i tshad bskal pa nyi shu thub lus dpag tshad phyed do //
translated: In their retinue, the Brahmakayika gods live twenty eons and their bodies are half a yojana in size.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang nye dbang sum cu rtsa gnyis /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang nye dbang sum cu rtsa gnyis /
translated: The lord of the gods is called Indra, who is surrounded by thirty two close gods.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig las byas pa'i nang na gnas /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig las byas pa'i nang na gnas /
translated: They live in the palace of Victory, which is made of one hundred one colors.🔽They live in the pleasure grove,

original: dga' pa'i tshal /🔽dgyes pa'i tshal /🔽rtsub 'gyur tshal /
analyzed: dga' pa'i tshal / dgyes pa'i tshal / rtsub 'gyur tshal /
translated: the grove of delight,🔽the grove of transformation,

original: sna tshogs tshal /
analyzed: sna tshogs tshal /
translated: the grove of variety,

original: grong khyer blta na sdug ces bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: grong khyer blta na sdug ces bya ba gnas so //
translated: and in the city called Beautiful to Behold.

original: ri rab kyi lcog gcig la /
analyzed: ri rab kyi lcog gcig la /
translated: On one peak of Mount Meru,

original: lag na rdo rje la gnod sbyin gyis bskor ba gnas so //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje la gnod sbyin gyis bskor ba gnas so //
translated: Vajrapani lives surrounded by yakshas.

original: ri rab gru bzhi kha tshon phyogs re re ra dpag tshad stong phrag bcu bcu yod do //
analyzed: ri rab gru bzhi kha tshon phyogs re re ra dpag tshad stong phrag bcu bcu yod do //
translated: Mount Meru is square, with each side ten thousand yojanas long.

original: rgyu rin chen bzhis byas pa'i steng 'di ni gser gyi sa gzhi shin tu bde zhing nyams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu rin chen bzhis byas pa'i steng 'di ni gser gyi sa gzhi shin tu bde zhing nyams dga' ba'o //
translated: The ground is made of four precious substances and is very pleasant and delightful.🔽On the ground of precious stones,

original: rdo aa mo li ka'i steng na koo shi ka chos 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo aa mo li ka'i steng na koo shi ka chos 'chad pa'o //
translated: Kośika teaches the Dharma.

original: shing yongs 'dus brtol yang dpag tshad lnga brgya yang skyes /
analyzed: shing yongs 'dus brtol yang dpag tshad lnga brgya yang skyes /
translated: The Pārijāta tree is also five hundred yojanas high,

original: dpag tshad lnga brgya mar zug / yan lag lnga pa yang dpag tshad drug cu yod do //
analyzed: dpag tshad lnga brgya mar zug / yan lag lnga pa yang dpag tshad drug cu yod do //
translated: five hundred yojanas wide, and sixty yojanas in circumference.

original: de @11b la lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'o //
analyzed: de @11b la lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'o //
translated: The gods and asuras fight over it.🔽The gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods,🔽the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods

original: sum cu rtsa gsum ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'brul dbang byed kyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang dga' ldan gyi lha rnams te /🔽gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi nges tshig ni 'og ma'i rdzu 'phrul dbang byed pas /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'brul dbang byed kyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang dga' ldan gyi lha rnams te / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi nges tshig ni 'og ma'i rdzu 'phrul dbang byed pas /
translated: are called the gods of the desire realm.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
translated: The definition of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods is that they control the magical powers of the lower gods.🔽Therefore, they are called the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: tshe tshad dang mi lo stong drug brgya la lha'i zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo drug stong thub /
analyzed: tshe tshad dang mi lo stong drug brgya la lha'i zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo drug stong thub /
translated: Their lifespan is six thousand years, with one day and night equaling one thousand six hundred human years.

original: lus la rgyang grags bcu yod do //
analyzed: lus la rgyang grags bcu yod do //
translated: Their bodies are ten krosa.

original: lha'i rgyal po la dbang byed pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po la dbang byed pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
translated: They are called Paranirmitavasavartins because they exercise power over the emanations of others.

original: 'phrul dga'i lha'i nges tshig ci 'dod pa rang gi lus las 'byung bas 'phrul dga'o //
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha'i nges tshig ci 'dod pa rang gi lus las 'byung bas 'phrul dga'o //
translated: The etymology of Nirmāṇarati is that they delight in their own emanations.

original: tshe tshad ni mi lo lnga brgya la /
analyzed: tshe tshad ni mi lo lnga brgya la /
translated: Their lifespan is five hundred human years

original: lha'i zhag gcig brtsis pa'i lo stong thub /
analyzed: lha'i zhag gcig brtsis pa'i lo stong thub /
translated: counted as one day. They live for one thousand such years.

original: lus la dpag tshad gcig bsam 'phel nor bu la longs spyod do //
analyzed: lus la dpag tshad gcig bsam 'phel nor bu la longs spyod do //
translated: Their bodies are one yojana and they enjoy the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i nges tshig ni lha ma yin gyi 'thab rtsod dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i nges tshig ni lha ma yin gyi 'thab rtsod dang bral pa'o //
translated: The etymology of Tuṣita is that they are free from the strife of the demigods.🔽Their lifespan is four thousand years,

original: tshe ni mi lo nyis brgya la zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i bzhi stong ngo //
analyzed: tshe ni mi lo nyis brgya la zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i bzhi stong ngo //
translated: counted as one day.

original: lus la rgyang grags bzhi yod /
analyzed: lus la rgyang grags bzhi yod /
translated: Their bodies are four krosa.

original: yang na lha'i rgyal po dga' ldan bya ba yod pas /
analyzed: yang na lha'i rgyal po dga' ldan bya ba yod pas /
translated: Alternatively, because the king of the gods is called Tuṣita,

original: dga' ldan no //
analyzed: dga' ldan no //
translated: it is Tuṣita.🔽They have sex by holding hands with the goddesses.

original: lha mo dang lag pa sprad pas 'khrig /'di ni 'thab bral lha'i nges tshig ni lha ma yin gyi 'thab rtsod dang bral bas so //
analyzed: lha mo dang lag pa sprad pas 'khrig /'di ni 'thab bral lha'i nges tshig ni lha ma yin gyi 'thab rtsod dang bral bas so //
translated: The etymology of Yāma is that they are free from the strife of the demigods.

original: 'thab bral gyi lha'i khang bzangs ni ri rab steng na khyim yod /
analyzed: 'thab bral gyi lha'i khang bzangs ni ri rab steng na khyim yod /
translated: The palaces of the gods of Yāma are on the peak of Mount Sumeru.

original: lha mo dang sbyor ba ni lus la 'khyud pa tsam gyis tshim /
analyzed: lha mo dang sbyor ba ni lus la 'khyud pa tsam gyis tshim /
translated: The gods and goddesses are satisfied by merely embracing each other.

original: mi lo dgu pa tsam gyi tshod skye ste /
analyzed: mi lo dgu pa tsam gyi tshod skye ste /
translated: They are born at the age of nine human years.

original: tshe tshad ni mi lo nyis brgya la lha'i zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i nyis stong thub po //
analyzed: tshe tshad ni mi lo nyis brgya la lha'i zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i nyis stong thub po //

analyzed: gang gi 'od ce na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bcom pa ni bzhi bcom /

original: ldan pa ni drug go //
analyzed: ldan pa ni drug go //

analyzed: 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

translated: Having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One means having rained down divine flowers, divine incense, divine lamps, divine ointments, divine mandara flowers, white lotuses, udumbara flowers, and so forth.

translated: Having sat to one side means having sat in one place.🔽With one voice means without duality.

analyzed: ngag gcig ces bya ba ni thams cad mthun pa'o //

analyzed: dbyangs gcig ces bya ba ni so so'i bstod pas mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase with a single voice means that they praise in unison.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de mngon par bstod pa zhes pa ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis bstod pa'o //
translated: The phrase they praised the Bhagavat with this verse means that the gods such as Brahma praised him.

analyzed: ji skad du bstod na / shin tu 'bar ba'i gser dang 'dra //

analyzed: zhes pa ni dper na gser mkhan gyis gser sbyangs pa'i 'od dang 'dra bas te /
translated: The phrase like blazing gold means that he is like the light of refined gold.

original: yang na nyi ma bdun gyi 'od dang 'dra ba'o //🔽zla ba nyi ma'i 'od dang mtshungs //
analyzed: yang na nyi ma bdun gyi 'od dang 'dra ba'o // zla ba nyi ma'i 'od dang mtshungs //
translated: Or, he is like the light of seven suns.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'od dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'od dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: The phrase like the light of the sun and moon means that he is equal to the light of the sun and moon.

original: dper na zla ba bsil bar byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na zla ba bsil bar byed pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the moon cools,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'o //
translated: he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni gnyis ldan te /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni gnyis ldan te /
translated: The phrase the glorious one means that he has two kinds of glory.

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dpal dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dpal lo //
translated: The glory of the world and the glory beyond the world.

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dpal ni 'jig rten la grags pa'o //🔽'jig rten las @13a * //
translated: The glory of the world is what is renowned in the world.🔽The glory beyond the world is the glory of the noble ones.

original: 'das pa'i dpal ni gnyis su med pa ste so so ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dpal ni gnyis su med pa ste so so ma yin no //
translated: The past glory is nondual, i.e., not distinct.

original: rnam thos kyi bu bzhin brtan zhes pa ni dper na rnam thos kyi bu'i nor la sogs pa zad pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu bzhin brtan zhes pa ni dper na rnam thos kyi bu'i nor la sogs pa zad pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: Like the son of Vaiśravaṇa, he is firm means that just as the wealth, etc. of the son of Vaiśravaṇa is inexhaustible,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan zad mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan zad mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so the qualities of the perfect Buddha are inexhaustible.

original: rin chen rnams kyi 'byung gnas lags //
analyzed: rin chen rnams kyi 'byung gnas lags //
translated: He is the source of jewels.🔽Just as a wish-fulfilling gem produces what is needed and desired,

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du dgos 'dod 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du dgos 'dod 'byung ba'o //
translated: he is the source of jewels.

original: seng ge glang chen 'dra ba'i 'gros //
analyzed: seng ge glang chen 'dra ba'i 'gros //
translated: He has the gait of a lion and an elephant.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na seng ge ni gcan gzan gyi rgyal po yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na seng ge ni gcan gzan gyi rgyal po yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a lion is the king of beasts,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: he is the antidote to all afflictions.

original: glang chen 'dra ba'i 'gros zhes bya ba ni dper na glang po che thogs rdugs med par 'gro ba bzhin du /
analyzed: glang chen 'dra ba'i 'gros zhes bya ba ni dper na glang po che thogs rdugs med par 'gro ba bzhin du /
translated: He has the gait of an elephant. Just as an elephant moves without impediment,

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi yang lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi yang lam mo //
translated: so does the Blessed One on the path.

original: glang chen myos pa bzhin du gnon //
analyzed: glang chen myos pa bzhin du gnon //
translated: He is like an elephant in rut, and like a mountain of gold.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na glang po che ra ro ba bzhin du dran pa med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na glang po che ra ro ba bzhin du dran pa med de /
translated: He is like an elephant in rut, for he is without memory.

original: de dang 'dra ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is like the perfect Buddha.

original: gser gyi ri ba dang yang mtshungs //🔽zhes bya ba ni dper na gser gyi ri bo ni brjid cing lhun sdug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gser gyi ri ba dang yang mtshungs // zhes bya ba ni dper na gser gyi ri bo ni brjid cing lhun sdug pa bzhin du /
translated: He is like a mountain of gold,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: for the body of the perfect Buddha is not displeasing to behold,🔽like a mountain of gold.🔽He is like an ornament of gold in Jambudvipa.

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi gser rgyan 'dra zhes pa ni ri rab kyi lho ngos na rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram na /
translated: On the southern side of Mount Meru, on the shore of the great ocean,

original: shing ljon pa'i 'dzam 'bras zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i 'dzam 'bras zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: 'dzam 'bras kyi 'bras bu mar la lhung bas rgya mtsho la yang mdog 'gyur ba'o //

original: de nas 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then it is called the Jambudvipa.

original: de'i 'og na gser yod de /
analyzed: de'i 'og na gser yod de /
translated: Under it there is gold.

original: shin tu dmar ba /
analyzed: shin tu dmar ba /

original: shin tu kha dog legs pa dag dang mnyam par byed /
analyzed: shin tu kha dog legs pa dag dang mnyam par byed /
translated: He is like the moon, surrounded by the stars.

original: dpe de bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang /🔽kha dog dang gzi brjid dang / yon tan gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang / kha dog dang gzi brjid dang / yon tan gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the Perfectly Awakened One

original: skrar ma rnams kyis yongs bskor ba //🔽zhes pa ni dper na skar ma ste /
analyzed: skrar ma rnams kyis yongs bskor ba // zhes pa ni dper na skar ma ste /
translated: is adorned with the ornaments of color, splendor, and good qualities.🔽He is surrounded by the stars.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The stars are the Hearers and so on.

original: bskor ba ni bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: bskor ba ni bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: They surround the Blessed One.

original: nam mkha'i zla ba dri med bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zla ba dri med bzhin //
translated: He is like the stainless moon in the sky.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na dbyar gyi nam mkha'i 'od bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dri ma dar bral ba'o //🔽nyan thos dge 'dun rnams kyi dbus //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na dbyar gyi nam mkha'i 'od bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dri ma dar bral ba'o // nyan thos dge 'dun rnams kyi dbus //
translated: The stainless moon in the sky is like the sky in the rainy season, free from the defilements of afflictions and so on.🔽In the midst of the assembly of Hearers.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgra @13b bcom pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgra @13b bcom pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams kyi dbus su'o //
translated: The assembly of Hearers is the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: mtshan rnams kyis ni brgyan par gyur //
analyzed: mtshan rnams kyis ni brgyan par gyur //
translated: He is adorned with the major marks.

original: zhes pa ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //
translated: This refers to the adornment with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: lha dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Together with the gods refers to Brahma and so on.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni gus par bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni gus par bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: This world refers to the Bhagavat.

original: thub pa la ni zhes bya ba drang srong thub pa zhes bya ba yod de de bzhin du de'i rgyud kyi thub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thub pa la ni zhes bya ba drang srong thub pa zhes bya ba yod de de bzhin du de'i rgyud kyi thub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sages refers to the sages of the seers, and so on. In the same way, the sages of that lineage are so called.

original: yang na lus ngag yid gsum thub pas thub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lus ngag yid gsum thub pas thub pa'o //
translated: Or else, the sages refers to the body, speech, and mind, because they are restrained.

original: skyabs su mchi zhes pas ni skyabs su 'gro bas na'o //🔽mi rnams la ni sman slad du //
analyzed: skyabs su mchi zhes pas ni skyabs su 'gro bas na'o // mi rnams la ni sman slad du //
translated: They go for refuge refers to going for refuge.

original: zhes pa ni bsrung ba dang skyob pa'o //🔽srung ba dus su nye bar gnas //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsrung ba dang skyob pa'o // srung ba dus su nye bar gnas //
translated: For the sake of healing humans refers to protection and refuge.

original: zhes bya ba ni srung ba ni ngan song gsum las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srung ba ni ngan song gsum las so //
translated: They stand guard at the proper time refers to protection from the three lower realms.

original: dus su ni nyen pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: dus su ni nyen pa'i dus su'o //
translated: At the proper time refers to the time of danger.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha refers to the abandonment of afflictions.

original: snga mas bshad pa'i zhes pa ni gangga'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brgyad khri bzhi stong gis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snga mas bshad pa'i zhes pa ni gangga'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brgyad khri bzhi stong gis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The “previously explained” refers to the eighty-four thousand Ganges river-like explanations.

original: stong chen zhes bya ba ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brgyad khri bzhi stong de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de'i sgo nas sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: stong chen zhes bya ba ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brgyad khri bzhi stong de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de'i sgo nas sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: “Great trichiliocosm” refers to the eighty-four thousand Ganges river-like thus-gone ones who have become buddhas through that gateway.

original: chen mo zhes pa ni de dang mnyam pa med pas so //
analyzed: chen mo zhes pa ni de dang mnyam pa med pas so //
translated: “Great” refers to the absence of equality with that.

original: rab ces bya ba ni mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rab ces bya ba ni mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: “Excellent” refers to the absence of inequality.

original: 'joms pa ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i bgegs rnams thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'joms pa ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i bgegs rnams thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Destroyer” refers to the destroyer of all the obstacles of the great trichiliocosm.

original: mdo sde de ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rabs bdun nas sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa man chod kyis brgyud pa ste /
analyzed: mdo sde de ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rabs bdun nas sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa man chod kyis brgyud pa ste /
translated: “That sūtra” refers to the lineage from the seven buddhas up to Buddha Śākyamuni.

original: yang na 'dzin pa /
analyzed: yang na 'dzin pa /
translated: Alternatively, it refers to upholding,

original: 'don pa / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'don pa / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: reciting, prostrating, and so forth.

original: khor khor yug ri mtha'i bar //
analyzed: khor khor yug ri mtha'i bar //
translated: Up to the outer rim of the ring of mountains.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbus su ri rab ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbus su ri rab ste /
translated: In the center is Mount Meru.

original: 'khor bas na khor yug go //
analyzed: 'khor bas na khor yug go //
translated: It is called “outer rim” because it encircles it.

original: gang 'khor zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'khor zhe na /
translated: What encircles it?

original: ri rab dang gling bzhi la sogs pa 'khor bas na 'khor pa'o //
analyzed: ri rab dang gling bzhi la sogs pa 'khor bas na 'khor pa'o //
translated: The world is so called because it revolves, i.e., it revolves around Meru, the four continents, etc.

original: mtshams gcod pa yi dam pa lags //
analyzed: mtshams gcod pa yi dam pa lags //
translated: The best of all boundaries.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshams gcod pa ni bsrung ba dang skyob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshams gcod pa ni bsrung ba dang skyob pa'o //
translated: The boundary is that which protects and guards.

original: yang na bgegs rnams thams cad bcing ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bgegs rnams thams cad bcing ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is the binding of all obstacles.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dang 'dra ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dang 'dra ba med pa'o //
translated: The best means that there is nothing like it.

original: phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Homage is to Brahma, etc.

original: skyes bu dpa' khyod la zhes pa gzhan dang mi 'dra ba nas skyes bu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dpa' khyod la zhes pa gzhan dang mi 'dra ba nas skyes bu'o //
translated: To you, O Hero of men means that you are a man who is not like others.

original: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na khams gsum @14a * //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro // yang na khams gsum @14a * //
translated: Hero means that you have conquered the four demons.

original: las rnam par rgyal bas dpa' bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las rnam par rgyal bas dpa' bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, you are a hero because you have conquered the three realms.

original: khyod la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: khyod la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: To you means to the Blessed One.

original: phyag 'tshal te tshangs pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te tshangs pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Homage is by Brahma, etc.

original: skyes bu ni khams gsum gyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ni khams gsum gyi dam pa'o //
translated: Man is the best of the three realms.

original: mchog khyod ni sangs rgyas rabs bdun man chod do //
analyzed: mchog khyod ni sangs rgyas rabs bdun man chod do //
translated: You, the supreme, are the seven generations of Buddhas.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni gnyis te kun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni gnyis te kun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is twofold: the conventional Dharma and the ultimate Dharma.

original: kun rdzob dang zhes bya ba ni log pa dang yang dag go //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang zhes bya ba ni log pa dang yang dag go //
translated: The conventional is twofold: false and true.

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: The ultimate is free from intrinsic reality.

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni ngag la dbang byed pas rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni ngag la dbang byed pas rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: The king is called a king because he has power over speech.

original: yang na khams gsum chos kyi dbang bskur pas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: yang na khams gsum chos kyi dbang bskur pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: Alternatively, he is a king because he is anointed with the Dharma of the three realms.

original: thub ces bya ba ni lus ngag yid gsum thub pas thub pa'o //
analyzed: thub ces bya ba ni lus ngag yid gsum thub pas thub pa'o //
translated: The sage is called a sage because he is restrained in body, speech, and mind.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The great is superior to others.

original: thal mo sbyar te tshangs pa la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te tshangs pa la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: With palms joined, he prostrates to Brahma and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa'i rting la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa'i rting la /
translated: Then, after dwelling,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bzhi bcom drug ldan mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bzhi bcom drug ldan mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the Bhagavan is nirvana endowed with four vanquishings and six excellences.

original: yud tsam zhig cang mi gsung bar dgongs nas zhes pa ni skad cig gis rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag bskul ba'o //
analyzed: yud tsam zhig cang mi gsung bar dgongs nas zhes pa ni skad cig gis rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag bskul ba'o //
translated: Having reflected for a moment, means that in an instant he exhorted the Four Great Kings.

original: ci'i phyir bskul zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bskul zhe na /
translated: Why did he exhort them?

original: skad cig gis ting nge 'dzin gyis bskul pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gis ting nge 'dzin gyis bskul pa'o //
translated: He exhorted them in an instant with samadhi.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag la bka' stsal ba zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od kyis bskul pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag la bka' stsal ba zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od kyis bskul pa'o //
translated: He spoke to the Four Great Kings, means that he exhorted them with the light of samadhi.

original: gang la bka' stsal na /
analyzed: gang la bka' stsal na /
translated: To whom did he speak?

original: rgyal po chen po dag gang khyed kyi zhes pa ni 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po dag gang khyed kyi zhes pa ni 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To the Great Kings,  means that he spoke to them together with their retinues.

original: khyod kyis nga'i 'khor la 'tshe bar sems pa de ni tshul ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis nga'i 'khor la 'tshe bar sems pa de ni tshul ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You should not think of harming my retinue, means that he spoke to them because they were devoid of compassion.

original: ci'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni sdig la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni sdig la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? means that he spoke to them because they were committing evil deeds.

original: rgyu ni sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is because they were equal to the Buddhas.

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten ni 'dzam bu'i gling du'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten ni 'dzam bu'i gling du'o //
translated: The human world is the Rose Apple Land.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni ma ga ngh'a ra ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni ma ga ngh'a ra ro //
translated: The appearance of a Buddha is in Magadha.

original: chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bya rgod phung po'i ri la'o //
analyzed: chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bya rgod phung po'i ri la'o //
translated: The well-spoken Dharma is on Vulture Peak.

original: dge 'dun lags par bsgrubs pa de las sa bon 'di btab nas zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi'i sgo nas btab pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lags par bsgrubs pa de las sa bon 'di btab nas zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi'i sgo nas btab pa'o //
translated: The well-established Sangha is the four immeasurables.

original: sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is free from the afflictions of desire, etc.

original: bcom @14b ldan 'das ni bzhi bcom drug ldan mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bcom @14b ldan 'das ni bzhi bcom drug ldan mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat is nirvana, with four destroyed and six possessed.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang zhes bya ba ni rang zhes bya ba rang byung gi ye shes dang / slob dpon med pa dang / lus kyi sgo nas sems can 'dul ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba'i phyir dang / rang 'byung ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang zhes bya ba ni rang zhes bya ba rang byung gi ye shes dang / slob dpon med pa dang / lus kyi sgo nas sems can 'dul ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba'i phyir dang / rang 'byung ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas are self-arisen gnosis, without a teacher, taming beings through the body, and having a special doctrine, and self-arisen gnosis.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams dang zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dgra bcom pa lnga brgya yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams dang zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dgra bcom pa lnga brgya yin te /
translated: The phrase the arhats refers to the five hundred arhats, such as Sariputra.

original: dgra ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term enemy refers to the mental afflictions, etc.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la lta ba gsum yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la lta ba gsum yod de /
translated: The term disciple refers to the three types of disciples.

original: nyan thos tha ma rab 'bring gsum mo //🔽nyan thos tha ma ni bye brag pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos tha ma rab 'bring gsum mo // nyan thos tha ma ni bye brag pa yin te /
translated: The term disciple refers to the three types of disciples: the inferior, the middling, and the superior.

original: gang zag gi sgo nas chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi sgo nas chos ston pa'o //
translated: The inferior disciple is the Vaibhasika, who teaches the Dharma from the perspective of the individual.

original: lta ba ni nga gcig pu sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni nga gcig pu sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: His view is that I alone will become a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gsum la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba dang / bde bar gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gsum la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba dang / bde bar gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He takes refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha, and he pays homage to the Sugatas.

original: nyan thos 'bring bo ni snga ma bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos 'bring bo ni snga ma bzhin du yin te /
translated: The middling disciple is similar to the previous one,

original: cung zad tsam sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: cung zad tsam sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: but he benefits sentient beings to a slight degree.

original: chos ni bye brag pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni bye brag pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the Vaibhasika.

original: rab ni snga ma bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: rab ni snga ma bzhin du yin te /
translated: The superior disciple is similar to the previous one,

original: chos ni kha che bye brag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos ni kha che bye brag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but the Dharma is the Kashmiri Vaibhasika.

original: chos bstan pa ni 'phags pa'i bden ba bzhi'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: chos bstan pa ni 'phags pa'i bden ba bzhi'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is taught by means of the four noble truths.

original: nyan thos kyi chos ni ngag gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos ni ngag gis bstan pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of the śrāvakas is taught by speech.

original: 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de kun yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de kun yang 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said, will appear in the world, and all that will happen.

original: de la 'jig rten de dag gis dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bcu la sogs pa'o //🔽srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs pa dang / rdzun du smra ba spangs ba dang / pra ma smra ba spangs pa dang / tshig rtsub pa smra ba spangs pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten de dag gis dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bcu la sogs pa'o // srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs pa dang / rdzun du smra ba spangs ba dang / pra ma smra ba spangs pa dang / tshig rtsub pa smra ba spangs pa dang /
translated: There, having generated the roots of virtue in those worlds, the roots of virtue are the ten wholesome actions, and so on.🔽Abandoning killing, abandoning stealing, abandoning sexual misconduct, abandoning false speech, abandoning divisive speech, abandoning harsh speech,

original: dag 'khyal ba spangs pa dang / brnab sems spangs pa dang / gnod sems spangs pa dang / log par lta ba spangs pa'o /
analyzed: dag 'khyal ba spangs pa dang / brnab sems spangs pa dang / gnod sems spangs pa dang / log par lta ba spangs pa'o /
translated: abandoning frivolous speech, abandoning covetousness, abandoning malice, and abandoning wrong view.

original: yang na stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma'i mdo sde la phyag 'tshal pa dang / bsgom pa dang / smon lam gdab pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i sgo nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma'i mdo sde la phyag 'tshal pa dang / bsgom pa dang / smon lam gdab pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i sgo nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is called the root of virtue that is produced by means of the homage, meditation, aspiration, and rejoicing in the sutra of the Great Lady Who Destroys the Great Void.

original: lha'i ris sum cu rtsa gnyis las lha'i ris gang yang rung ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i sgo nas zhes pa'o //🔽rgyal po dag kyang dmag @15a * //
analyzed: lha'i ris sum cu rtsa gnyis las lha'i ris gang yang rung ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i sgo nas zhes pa'o // rgyal po dag kyang dmag @15a * //
translated: One will be born in any of the thirty-two god realms means by means of that root of virtue.

original: bzhi dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnam bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnam bzhi ste /
translated: The kings will have the four armies means the four retinues.

original: rgyal po bzhi de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The four kings have that.

original: gling bzhi ni lus 'phags po dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / ba lang spyod pa dang / sgra mi snyan no //
analyzed: gling bzhi ni lus 'phags po dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / ba lang spyod pa dang / sgra mi snyan no //
translated: The four continents are Videha, Jambudvipa, Godaniya, and Kuru.

original: dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal po bzhi'o //
analyzed: dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal po bzhi'o //
translated: The mahasattvas are the four kings.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni dbang sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni dbang sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they control, they are called chakravartins.

original: rgya mtsho la thug pa'i zhes bya ba ni khor khor yug tshun chad do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la thug pa'i zhes bya ba ni khor khor yug tshun chad do //
translated: Up to the ocean's shore means up to the outer ring of mountains.

analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa /

analyzed: de stong 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gnas pa ni brtan pa'o //

analyzed: rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa /

analyzed: 'od dang ldan pa /

analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa /

analyzed: grags pa dang ldan pa /

analyzed: gnas dang zhes bya ba ni lus dan po'i gnas so //

analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa ji tsam pa bzhin du spyod pa'o //

analyzed: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la spangs pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bzhi bcom drug ldan mya ngan las 'das pa'o ;

analyzed: ; bdag cag ces pa ni rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: des ma thos pas chos dang mi ldan pa'o //

analyzed: 'khor zas dang skom tshol du phyogs bcu kun du @16b 'byer zhing /

analyzed: bud med dang zhes bya ba ni bud med bu skyes pa'i dus su yang zas tshol ba'o //

analyzed: khye'u dang zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: khye'u'i gzugs su byas nas zas tshol ba'o //

original: bu mo dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bu mo dang zhes pa ni /
translated: “Girls”

original: bu mo'i gzugs can du byas nas so //
analyzed: bu mo'i gzugs can du byas nas so //
translated: means that they have taken on the form of girls.

analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i zhes pa ni dud 'gro la gnod par byed pa'o //

analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi mdangs 'phrog 'tshe bar bgyid ces bya ba ni srog chags zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The line harmful to living beings refers to humans and so on.

analyzed: mdangs 'phrog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The line stealing their radiance refers to

analyzed: bgegs bgyid ces bya ba ni bzhi dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: 'gum par bgyid ces pa ni 'chi bdag go //

original: srog dang 'bral bar bgyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srog dang 'bral bar bgyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line taking away their life refers to

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'o //

analyzed: spyan sngar ni mdun du'o //

analyzed: dmu chu skran dang rgyu nad dang // glo nad dbugs dang snying nad dang // mcher pa mkhal ma bu snod la //

analyzed: seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la gsum ste /

original: dge ba spyad pas mtho ris kyi gnas yin la /🔽ngan song rnams min pa ni 'dod pa gzhan gyi dbang ngo //

translated: The power of meditation is the knowledge of the various kinds of higher interests of beings, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.🔽The power of the various elements is the knowledge of the various elements of beings, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.🔽The power of the various faculties is the knowledge of the various faculties of beings, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.🔽The power of the paths that lead everywhere is the knowledge of the paths that lead to all destinations, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.🔽The power of recollection of former abodes is the knowledge of the former abodes of beings, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.🔽The power of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the deaths and rebirths of beings, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.

original: log par spyad pa ni ngan song gi gnas yin gyi mtho ris kyi gnas ma yin pa ni mi 'dod pa gzhan gyi dbang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //

translated: The power of the destruction of the impurities is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, such as the fact that the attainment of the higher realms is desirable, if one practices virtue.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs 'di ni dbang po rnon po de'i rigs can yin /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs 'di ni dbang po rnon po de'i rigs can yin /

original: 'di ni rtul po nyan thos kyi rigs can yin pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtul po nyan thos kyi rigs can yin pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //

analyzed: khyu mchog lta bu ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo'o //
translated: The bull is the noble Ananda.

original: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni nam mkhas ji ltar khyab par stong pa'i sgras khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni nam mkhas ji ltar khyab par stong pa'i sgras khyab pa'o //
translated: The vast refers to the sound of emptiness pervading everywhere, just as space pervades.

original: stong pa'i sgra des ci'i don byed ce na /
analyzed: stong pa'i sgra des ci'i don byed ce na /
translated: What purpose does that sound of emptiness serve?

original: sems can thams cad grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: It liberates all sentient beings.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The true refers to the unmistaken dharmakaya.

original: chos kyi sku ste dper na ci dang 'dra na /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ste dper na ci dang 'dra na /
translated: What is the dharmakaya like?

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: It is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: brjod du ni mi rung /
analyzed: brjod du ni mi rung /
translated: It cannot be expressed.

original: dngos por ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist as a thing.

original: de ni chos kyi sku'i dpe'o //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi sku'i dpe'o //
translated: This is the example of the Dharma Body.

original: bsgrags so zhes bya ba ni dngos su ste /
analyzed: bsgrags so zhes bya ba ni dngos su ste /
translated: It is proclaimed means directly.

original: gzugs sku gnyis kyis don byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sku gnyis kyis don byed pa'o //
translated: The two Form Bodies perform benefits.

original: gzugs sku gnyis ni dper na g-yas gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs sku gnyis ni dper na g-yas gi rva bzhin no //
translated: The two Form Bodies are like the right horn.

original: g-yag gi rvas ni dngos por yang snang la 'bigs par byed pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yag gi rvas ni dngos por yang snang la 'bigs par byed pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The right horn appears as an entity, but it does not pierce.

original: de'i phyir na gzugs sku rnam gnyis kyis ni yod pa'i don byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gzugs sku rnam gnyis kyis ni yod pa'i don byas so //
translated: Therefore, the two Form Bodies perform the benefit of existence.

original: chos skus ni med pa'i don byas //
analyzed: chos skus ni med pa'i don byas //
translated: The Dharma Body performs the benefit of non-existence.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i don byas pa'i phyir na stong pa nyid kyi sgra bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i don byas pa'i phyir na stong pa nyid kyi sgra bsgrags pa'o //
translated: Because it performs the benefit of existence and non-existence, the sound of emptiness is proclaimed.

original: tshangs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs kyis spyo ba brgyad kun dga' bo la byas pas tshangs pa'i phyir na tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs kyis spyo ba brgyad kun dga' bo la byas pas tshangs pa'i phyir na tshangs pa'o //
translated: Brahma means that because Kasyapa scolded Ananda eight times, it is Brahma because it is pure.

original: 'khor lo bskor zhes bya ba ni bka'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bskor zhes bya ba ni bka'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: Turning the wheel means turning the wheel of the Dharma of the Buddha's words.

original: sde zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi rigs bzhi'o //
analyzed: sde zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi rigs bzhi'o //
translated: Army means the four types of Mara.

original: mthu dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i nus pa'o //
translated: Power means the ability of each.

original: gzhon pa la ni lha mi'i bu'i cha byad do //
analyzed: gzhon pa la ni lha mi'i bu'i cha byad do //
translated: The young one is the son of a god or man.

original: bcas pa ni bdud kyi rigs bye ba dung phyur phrag bco lnga'o //
analyzed: bcas pa ni bdud kyi rigs bye ba dung phyur phrag bco lnga'o //
translated: The retinue is the fifteen hundred and twenty billion types of Mara.

original: bdud kyang gcig gis rab tu btul zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bdud kyang gcig gis rab tu btul zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The one Mara is the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha.

original: de la dang po bzhi la lha'i bdud ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na /
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi la lha'i bdud ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na /
translated: The first four are the divine Mara. In the realm of the Paranirmitavasavartins,

original: bdud kyi rgyal po dga' rab dbang phyug ces bya ba dang / bdud mo padmo gzi ldan ma /
analyzed: bdud kyi rgyal po dga' rab dbang phyug ces bya ba dang / bdud mo padmo gzi ldan ma /
translated: there is the Mara king called Nanda, the Mara lady called Padmasadvara,

original: 'khor 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi /
analyzed: 'khor 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi /
translated: and the retinue of the four world guardians.

original: bdud kyi rigs bye ba dung phyur phrag bco lnga yod de /
analyzed: bdud kyi rigs bye ba dung phyur phrag bco lnga yod de /
translated: There are fifteen hundred and twenty billion types of Mara.

original: de la lha'i rigs su skyes bas lha'i @25a * //
analyzed: de la lha'i rigs su skyes bas lha'i @25a * //
translated: Among them, the one born in the divine type is the son of a god.

original: bu yin la zhi ba de thar pa'i srog gcod pa 'phags pa'i nor 'phrogs pas kyang bdud yin no //
analyzed: bu yin la zhi ba de thar pa'i srog gcod pa 'phags pa'i nor 'phrogs pas kyang bdud yin no //
translated: He is also Mara because he kills the life of peace and steals the wealth of the noble ones.

original: de lta na bdud kyi rigs bye ba phrag dung phyur bco lnga yod pas bar du gcod do //
analyzed: de lta na bdud kyi rigs bye ba phrag dung phyur bco lnga yod pas bar du gcod do //
translated: Thus, the fifteen hundred and twenty billion types of Mara create obstacles.

original: des chod na 'khor 'jig rten skyong ba bzhis bar du gcod do //
analyzed: des chod na 'khor 'jig rten skyong ba bzhis bar du gcod do //
translated: If that is eliminated, the four guardians of the world will create obstacles.🔽

original: de yang gcig sbyin pa'i bar /🔽gcig gis bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gcig sbyin pa'i bar / gcig gis bzod pa'o //
translated: If that is overcome, the four world guardians who are part of the retinue create obstacles.🔽One creates obstacles to generosity,🔽one to patience,

original: gcig gis brtson 'grus kyi bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gis brtson 'grus kyi bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: and one to diligence.

original: des kyang mchod na bdud kyi rgyal po dga' rab dbang phyug dang / bdud mo padma gzi ldan ma chags pa'i mda' lnga 'phen te gdung ske mar ro myos dang smyo /
analyzed: des kyang mchod na bdud kyi rgyal po dga' rab dbang phyug dang / bdud mo padma gzi ldan ma chags pa'i mda' lnga 'phen te gdung ske mar ro myos dang smyo /
translated: If that is overcome, the king of demons, Nandīśvara, and the demoness, Padmābha, shoot five arrows of passion.

original: mda' lnga yin par shes par bya ;
analyzed: mda' lnga yin par shes par bya ;
translated: One should know that the five arrows are: madness, intoxication,🔽and so forth.

original: ; de lta bu'i tshul gyis bar du gcod pa'i phyir na bdud do //
analyzed: ; de lta bu'i tshul gyis bar du gcod pa'i phyir na bdud do //
translated: In that way, because they create obstacles, they are demons.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The demon of afflictions is the afflictions such as desire.

original: de rnams ma zhi ba'i rnam pa bskyed pas /
analyzed: de rnams ma zhi ba'i rnam pa bskyed pas /
translated: Since they generate the aspect of non-pacification,

original: nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: they are afflictions.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i bgegs byed pas 'phags pa'i nor 'phrog pa'i bdud kyang yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i bgegs byed pas 'phags pa'i nor 'phrog pa'i bdud kyang yin no //
translated: Since they create obstacles to attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, they are also demons that steal the wealth of the āryas.

original: phung po'i bdud ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: phung po'i bdud ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bya ste /
translated: The demon of the aggregates is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de nyid spungs pas na phung po'o //
analyzed: de nyid spungs pas na phung po'o //
translated: Since it is a heap of those, it is a skandha.

original: de nyid na ba dang rgas pa 'khogs pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pas bdud do //
analyzed: de nyid na ba dang rgas pa 'khogs pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pas bdud do //
translated: Since it is an obstruction to health, aging, decrepitude, and so on, it is a demon.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni dngos su rang gi tshe 'di'i 'phen pa zad nas 'chi ba yin pa la de'i phyag rgya ma 'am rtags su 'gro ba rnams kyi bdud rang gi lhag pa'i phyogs na gnas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni dngos su rang gi tshe 'di'i 'phen pa zad nas 'chi ba yin pa la de'i phyag rgya ma 'am rtags su 'gro ba rnams kyi bdud rang gi lhag pa'i phyogs na gnas zhes pa ste /
translated: The demon of the Lord of Death is the actual death that occurs when the impetus of this life is exhausted. The seal or sign of that is the demon of the Lord of Death that resides in the superior direction of beings.

original: gshin rje'i rgyal po be ba sva ta zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gshin rje'i rgyal po be ba sva ta zhes bya ba /
translated: The king of the Lord of Death is called Vevasvata.

original: lus po mi'i lus la mgo bo seng ge'i mgo bo can /
analyzed: lus po mi'i lus la mgo bo seng ge'i mgo bo can /
translated: His body is the body of a human with the head of a lion.

original: mig rtsa dmar po gcig gnas te /
analyzed: mig rtsa dmar po gcig gnas te /
translated: He has one red-veined eye.

original: de 'chi ba la dbang byed pas na 'chi bdag kyang yin la der a'arya'i nor 'phrog pa thar pa la bgegs byed pas bdud kyang yin no //
analyzed: de 'chi ba la dbang byed pas na 'chi bdag kyang yin la der a'arya'i nor 'phrog pa thar pa la bgegs byed pas bdud kyang yin no //
translated: Since he controls death, he is the Lord of Death. Since he steals the wealth of the āryas and creates obstacles for liberation, he is a demon.

original: de ltar yang 'gro ba rnams ni do nub 'di bya nang par 'di byed las gzhan yang 'di bya sems pas na /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'gro ba rnams ni do nub 'di bya nang par 'di byed las gzhan yang 'di bya sems pas na /
translated: Thus, beings think, “Tonight I will do this. Tomorrow I will do that. I will do this other thing.”

original: gshin rje'i rgyal po mig rtsa dmar bas ma rungs snyam pa dgod par byed ces pas so //
analyzed: gshin rje'i rgyal po mig rtsa dmar bas ma rungs snyam pa dgod par byed ces pas so //
translated: The Lord of Death, his eyes red, will laugh at you, thinking you are a fool.

original: de rnams btul ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams btul ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is endowed with the power to subdue them.

original: de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa ste /
translated: This power is both relative and ultimate.

original: de yang dang po ni rdo rje gdan gyi spo la sangs rgyas pa'i tshe bdud dga' rab dang phyug gis rig nas bdud mo padma gzi ldan ma dang bcas pa mya ngan gyi khang bar zhugs /
analyzed: de yang dang po ni rdo rje gdan gyi spo la sangs rgyas pa'i tshe bdud dga' rab dang phyug gis rig nas bdud mo padma gzi ldan ma dang bcas pa mya ngan gyi khang bar zhugs /
translated: The first is as follows. When the Buddha was about to attain enlightenment on the peak of Vajra Seat, Mara, the evil one, and his wife, the demoness Padma Dawa, became aware of this and entered a house of sorrow.🔽At that time, his retinue asked, “Chief, why have you entered a house of sorrow and are you grieving?”

original: de'i tshe 'khor rnams kyis smras pa gtso bo ci'i phyir na @25b mya ngan gyi khang par zhugs mya ngan byed ces ba dang / gtso bos smras pa 'jig rten 'dzam bu'i gling 'di na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor rnams kyis smras pa gtso bo ci'i phyir na @25b mya ngan gyi khang par zhugs mya ngan byed ces ba dang / gtso bos smras pa 'jig rten 'dzam bu'i gling 'di na /
translated: The chief replied, “In this world of Jambudvipa,

original: gzhon nu don grub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: gzhon nu don grub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: the youth Siddhārtha has attained complete enlightenment.

original: de sangs rgyas nas 'dod pa'i khams stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas nas 'dod pa'i khams stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he has become a buddha, the desire realm will become empty.

original: bdag cag mnga' ris gang la bya ste /
analyzed: bdag cag mnga' ris gang la bya ste /
translated: What will we do with our subjects?

original: de'i phyir na mya ngan byed zer te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na mya ngan byed zer te /
translated: That is why I am grieving.”

original: 'khor rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'khor rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The retinue said:

original: mya ngan ma byed de bas bar du gcod ces smras so //
analyzed: mya ngan ma byed de bas bar du gcod ces smras so //
translated: Do not grieve, for this is an obstacle.

original: dang po bdud kyi bu mo shin tu mdzes pa bzhi sbrul te /
analyzed: dang po bdud kyi bu mo shin tu mdzes pa bzhi sbrul te /
translated: First, four very beautiful demon daughters were emanated,

original: bha ga b'an la chags pa skye ba'i phyir na gtang bas /
analyzed: bha ga b'an la chags pa skye ba'i phyir na gtang bas /
translated: in order to generate attachment to the Bhagavān.

original: bha ga b'a na mi sdug pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs /
analyzed: bha ga b'a na mi sdug pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs /
translated: The Bhagavān, in order to be unattractive, entered into meditative stabilization.

original: rgan mo mi sdug pa sprang mo zhar ma lta bu bzhi ru gyur to //
analyzed: rgan mo mi sdug pa sprang mo zhar ma lta bu bzhi ru gyur to //
translated: [The demon daughters] became four ugly old women, like beggars.

original: de nas 'khor 'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mtshon cha'i char phab pas /
analyzed: de nas 'khor 'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mtshon cha'i char phab pas /
translated: Then the worldly retinue and so forth caused a rain of weapons to fall.

original: bha gas byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: bha gas byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavān entered into the meditative stabilization of love.

original: me tog gi char du gyur to //
analyzed: me tog gi char du gyur to //
translated: [The weapons] became a rain of flowers.

original: de nas sprul pa'i tshogs khro bo dpag tu med pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i tshogs khro bo dpag tu med pa rnams kyis /
translated: Then the immeasurable wrathful hosts of emanations

original: aom ya m'anta ka h'um zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: aom ya m'anta ka h'um zhes brjod pas /
translated: recited Oṃ yamāntaka hūṃ.

original: 'tshe ba rtogs shig pa'i sgra nam mkha' khyab par bsgrags pas bdud 'khor thams cad dbang du bsdus so //
analyzed: 'tshe ba rtogs shig pa'i sgra nam mkha' khyab par bsgrags pas bdud 'khor thams cad dbang du bsdus so //
translated: The sound Recognize the harm! pervaded the sky, and all the retinue of demons were brought under control.

original: mthong tsam cig nas bdud dga' rab dbang phyug dang padma gzi ldan shor ro //
analyzed: mthong tsam cig nas bdud dga' rab dbang phyug dang padma gzi ldan shor ro //
translated: Rāvaṇa and Padmaśrīn were lost.

original: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud btul bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud btul bar gyur te /
translated: Then he subdued the demon of the god of the desire realm.

original: de nas tho rangs rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs ba rkang la gnas pa dang / spyi la gnas pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: de nas tho rangs rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs ba rkang la gnas pa dang / spyi la gnas pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: Then at dawn, with the vajra-like concentration, he abandoned all the afflictions that were located in the body and in the mind and that were to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas nyon mongs pa'i bdud btul bar gyur to //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas nyon mongs pa'i bdud btul bar gyur to //
translated: Having become a perfect buddha, he subdued the demon of the afflictions.🔽Then, on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, after six years of austerities, he became emaciated and thin.

original: de nas chu bo nee ranydza na'i 'gram du dka' thub lo drug mdzad pa rjud cing rid par gyur pa la tshong dpon gyi bu mo legs skyes mas ba lnga brgya'i 'o ma gdus pa drangs pas /
analyzed: de nas chu bo nee ranydza na'i 'gram du dka' thub lo drug mdzad pa rjud cing rid par gyur pa la tshong dpon gyi bu mo legs skyes mas ba lnga brgya'i 'o ma gdus pa drangs pas /
translated: The merchant’s daughter Sujātā offered him a meal of rice and milk boiled with five hundred ingredients.

original: sku gser gyi brtan pa phyis pa ltar song /
analyzed: sku gser gyi brtan pa phyis pa ltar song /
translated: His body became like polished gold.

original: sha med / khrag med /
analyzed: sha med / khrag med /
translated: He was without flesh and without blood.

original: rgas pa med par gyur to //
analyzed: rgas pa med par gyur to //
translated: He became free of old age.

original: de la ltar na phung po'i bdud btul //
analyzed: de la ltar na phung po'i bdud btul //
translated: In this way, he subdued the demon of the aggregates.

original: de nas lo brgyad cu na sku mya ngan las 'das pa la bram ze su ka tos gsol ba btab /
analyzed: de nas lo brgyad cu na sku mya ngan las 'das pa la bram ze su ka tos gsol ba btab /
translated: Then, at the age of eighty, he passed into nirvana, at which point the Brahmin Sukata made a request.

original: sku tshe ring bar dbang mnga' brnyes pa'i rtags su lo gnyis bzhugs pas 'chi bdag gi bdud btul lo //
analyzed: sku tshe ring bar dbang mnga' brnyes pa'i rtags su lo gnyis bzhugs pas 'chi bdag gi bdud btul lo //
translated: Since he remained for two years, he conquered the demon of death, the sign of having attained mastery over longevity.

original: de nas don dam par btul ba ni /
analyzed: de nas don dam par btul ba ni /
translated: Then, the ultimate conquest is as follows.

original: de ltar na bdud bzhi snang ba nyid rang gi ye shes de de lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar na bdud bzhi snang ba nyid rang gi ye shes de de lta bur snang ste /
translated: Thus, the four demons appear as the wisdom of the individual.

original: sna tshogs su snang ba sbrul pa'i sku /
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang ba sbrul pa'i sku /
translated: The appearance of diversity is the nirmāṇakāya.

original: @26a * // de lta bur de yang rang rig par rig pa longs sku /
analyzed: @26a * // de lta bur de yang rang rig par rig pa longs sku /
translated: That is also the sambhogakāya, the awareness of one’s vidyā.

original: de nyid btsal na gang du yang ma rnyed pas /
analyzed: de nyid btsal na gang du yang ma rnyed pas /
translated: If one searches for that, it is not found anywhere.

original: stong pa 'od gsal ba chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: stong pa 'od gsal ba chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The empty clear light is the dharmakāya.

original: sems can thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to protect all sentient beings means

original: snying rje'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: snying rje'i sgo nas so //
translated: through compassion.

original: rig sngags zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rig sngags zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: The vidyā mantra is emptiness.

original: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes bas nye bar len pa'i rgyu byas /
analyzed: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes bas nye bar len pa'i rgyu byas /
translated: Moreover, the ālaya consciousness acts as the cause of appropriation.

original: stobs rnam pa lngas lhan cig skyes pa'i rkyen byas /
analyzed: stobs rnam pa lngas lhan cig skyes pa'i rkyen byas /
translated: The five aspects of power act as the condition for the connate [joy].

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas 'gyur ba me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas 'gyur ba me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: The transformation of the all-base consciousness is mirrorlike wisdom.

original: stong pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i don rtogs pas /
analyzed: stong pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i don rtogs pas /
translated: Since the meaning of being free from all extremes of emptiness is realized,

original: rig sngags mtshan nyid pa ste /
analyzed: rig sngags mtshan nyid pa ste /
translated: it is an authentic awareness mantra.

original: de'i mtshon cha me long lta bu'i ye shes ;
analyzed: de'i mtshon cha me long lta bu'i ye shes ;
translated: The weapon of that [wisdom] is mirrorlike wisdom.

original: mtshon pa stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma ste /
analyzed: mtshon pa stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma ste /
translated: The symbol of that is the great emptiness conqueror.

original: sku mdog dang zhal phyag gi rnam par byung ba'o //
analyzed: sku mdog dang zhal phyag gi rnam par byung ba'o //
translated: It arises in the form of a body color, faces, and hands.

original: de sku mdog ni mthing ga zhal gsum pa ste g-yas kyi zhal zhi ba dkar mo dregs pa'i tshul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de sku mdog ni mthing ga zhal gsum pa ste g-yas kyi zhal zhi ba dkar mo dregs pa'i tshul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The body color is blue, with three faces. The right face is white and peaceful, with a haughty manner.

original: g-yon dmar mo rgod pa dbang gi tshul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dmar mo rgod pa dbang gi tshul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The left face is red and wrathful, with a manner of control.

original: dang po'i zhal mthing ka khro mo ste /
analyzed: dang po'i zhal mthing ka khro mo ste /
translated: The first face is blue and wrathful,

original: drag po'i tshul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: drag po'i tshul dang ldan pa'o //
